title: kasuga_maru_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort carrier [i]Kasuga Maru[/i]. Upon remodeling, her name changes to [[Taiyou (kancolle)|]]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[brown hair]] in a [[folded ponytail]] held in place with a [[blue_ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], and [[swept bangs]].  She has [[brown_eyes|brown]] [[tareme]]-style eyes. Similar to [[Akagi (kancolle)|]] and [[Kaga (kancolle)|]], [[Shibafu_(glock23)|]]'s other fleet carriers, she wears a white [[dougi]] top with a red [[hakama short skirt]], and [[black socks]]. On her left hand, she wears a thick falconry [[gloves|glove]].

Her [[rigging]] involves a [[flight deck]] strapped to her right arm, falconry-related steel pouches strapped to her torso, and steel [[platform boots]]. She is notably is modeled upon "classic Japanese falconry":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Takagari] unlike the majority of carriers in-game that are either archers, onmyoji, or marksmen. 

Historically, the [i]Kasuga Maru[/i] was originally built as a [i]Nitta Maru[/i] class passenger-cargo liner, but was requisitioned by the Imperial Japanese Navy and converted into the escort aircraft carrier [i]Taiyou[/i] without ever seeing service as an ocean liner. As [i]Taiyou[/i], she was initially used to transport aircraft and for training, but was later used to escort merchant convoys. She was sunk by a US submarine on August 18, 1944.

One of her lines references "an advertisement":[http://otakei.otakuma.net/wp/wp-content/uploads/2012/01/210.jpg] where she was anthropomorphized alongside her sister-ships even back in the 1940s. 

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Escort Princess]].

title: taiyou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort carrier [i]Taiyou[/i]. The remodeled form of [[Kasuga Maru (Kancolle)|]]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]]. 

As Taiyou (but not Taiyou Kai), she is visually nearly identical to her unremodeled form, and has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[brown hair]] in a [[folded ponytail]] held in place with a [[blue_ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], and [[swept bangs]].  She has [[brown_eyes|brown]] [[tareme]]-style eyes.  Similar to [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu's]] [[akagi (kancolle)|fleet]] [[kaga (kancolle)|carriers]], Kasuga Maru wears a white [[dougi]] top with a red [[hakama short skirt]], and [[black socks]].  On her left hand, she wears a thick falconry [[gloves|glove]].  Following further remodeling, she wears an olive dougi with a green hakama skirt, and in Kai-Ni, she wears a grey [[scarf]].

Her [[machinery|rigging]] involves a [[flight deck]] strapped to her right arm, falconry-related steel cases strapped to her torso, and steel [[platform boots]].  In [[Taiyou Kai Ni (kancolle)|her Kai-Ni form]], she also wears [[headphones]] with a radio tower on the right side, and her flight deck has a [[camouflage]] pattern.

Her name means "goshawk", which was a prized bird of prey among the Edo-era Samurai class.

title: abukuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Abukuma[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in an elaborate hairstyle featuring [[double bun]] and [[hair rings]] reminiscent of [[Tsukino Usagi]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her base outfit is shared with her sisters Kinu and Yura: a buttoned [[white shirt]] with light [[green sailor collar]], light [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of four 14 cm single gun mounts (two on her wrists, two on her rig), held by a funnel piece to her back. 

She is a somewhat high-strung and self-conscious girl. She tends to fuss over her hair excessively, apparently as a joke about how her bow was destroyed in a collision with [[Kitakami (Kancolle)|]]. Kitakami is portrayed as having a teasing/dominant relationship with Abukuma because of this (see pool #7431).

title: fate/stay_night
body:
An eroge by [[Type-Moon]], released in January 2004 and made into a 24-episode TV anime in 2006. The game is the first installemnt of the [[Fate (series)|]] franchise.

Original character designs and most official art made by [[Takeuchi Takashi]].

Consists of three divergent routes, each focusing on a different heroine:

* [[Fate/Stay Night]] - [[Saber (fate)|]]
* [[Fate/Unlimited Blade Works]] - [[Tohsaka Rin]]
* [[Heaven's Feel]] - [[Matou Sakura]]

Note that the above route tags should only be used when the pictures specifically mention said route, or when they show an event that only appears in it. 

The sequel is [[Fate/Hollow Ataraxia]].

title: mighty_strike_freedom_gundam
body:
[b]ZGMF/A-262PD-P Mighty Strike Freedom Gundam [/b]
Appearing in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]], it is the combined form of the upgraded [[Strike Freedom Gundam]] Type II (piloted by [[Kira Yamato]]) and the new Proud Defender support unit (piloted by [[Lacus Clyne]]). 

While the Mighty Strike Freedom loses its Super [[funnels (Gundam)|DRAGOON]] & [I]Wings of the Skies[/I] backpack during the combining process, it is instead gains access to 2 new systems: a defensive one that allows it to generate a protective energy field, and an offensive one that unleashes a wide-scale EMP that can shut down enemy targets and destroy projectiles within a large area around it.

The Mighty Strike Freedom also has full access to its [[v-fin]]-mounted "Disruptor" [[beam cannon]] unlike its base Type II form due to its power requirements. It is also equipped with a "Futsunomitama" solid [[katana]].
other_names: マイティーストライクフリーダムガンダム

title: destiny_gundam_spec_ii
body:
[b]ZGMF/A-42S2 Destiny Gundam Spec II [/b]

Upgraded version of the [[Destiny Gundam]] that appears in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]] movie. [[Shinn Asuka]] remains as its pilot. 

It mostly resembles the original Destiny except that the Spec II's color scheme is darker, the light blue colors on the original's chest as well as the color of its "Arondight" anti-ship sword are both replaced with white, and the v-fin is now grey-colored instead of yellow. The new color scheme is quite similar to that of the [[Legend Gundam]], which is piloted by the late [[Rey Za Burrel]]. In-universe, this is Shinn's tribute to his fallen friend and comrade. 

The Destiny Spec II retains the original's weapons though its systems gained several upgrades. It has improved Variable Phase Shift Armor (which is the reason of its modified color scheme), it is now equipped with Deuterion Beam Energy Transfer System for recharging battery-powered mobile suits which are equipped with a Deuterion Beam receiver such as the Impulse Gundam Spec II, and its signature [I]Wings of Light[/I] is also enhanced. It is now capable of producing more realistic, clone-like afterimages that is also more abundant in quantity than the original, enabling the Destiny Spec II to cause greater confusion to its enemies in combat. 

Additionally, the Destiny Gundam Spec II has a new inner frame capable of improved performance, which glows red at maximum power output.
other_names: デスティニーガンダムSpecII

body:
[b]ZGMF-MM07 Z'Gok [/b]
Piloted by [[Athrun Zala]], it is Cosmic Era's incarnation of the [[Z'Gok]] [[mobile suit]] from Universal Century, appearing in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]]. [spoilers]It is actually the disguised form of his upgraded [[Infinite Justice Gundam Type II]].[/spoilers]

title: infinite_justice_gundam_type_ii
body:
[b]ZGMF-X191M2 Infinite Justice Gundam Type II[/b]
An upgraded version of [[Infinite Justice Gundam]] that appears in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]]. [[Athrun Zala]] remains as its pilot. [spoilers]Also initially disguised as the [[Z'Gok (SEED)|]], which is Cosmic Era's incarnation of its [[Z'Gok|namesake]] [[mobile suit]] from Universal Century.[/spoilers]

The Type II is equipped with a new 4-winged sub-flight lifter backpack (which resembles the [[X-Wing]] from [[Star Wars]]) with improved firepower, including additional [[energy sword]] emitters and missile launchers. Its signature long mohawk sensor is also equipped with a [[energy blade|beam blade]] emitter as its hidden weapon.
other_names: インフィニットジャスティスガンダム弐式

title: rising_freedom_gundam
body:
[b]STTS-909 Rising Freedom Gundam[/b]
[[Kira Yamato]]'s [[mobile suit]] in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]] movie. 

It is equipped with a pair of hip-mounted [[railgun|railguns]] and a pair of wing-mounted [[beam cannon|beam cannons]], bringing back the original [[Freedom Gundam]]'s version of the [I]Full Burst Mode[/I] loadout. However, it is not equipped with the version of the [[Strike Freedom Gundam]]'s [[funnels (Gundam)|DRAGOON System]] nor its Voiture Lumiere System/[I][[energy wings|Wings of the Skies]][/I]. It also transforms into a a fighter-like form, making it the first time that Kira pilots a transformable mobile suit.
other_names: ライジングフリーダムガンダム
ライジングフリーダム

title: immortal_justice_gundam
body:
[b]STTS-808 Immortal Justice Gundam[/b]
A [[mobile suit]] in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]] movie. Piloted by [[Shinn Asuka]].

Unlike the  original [[Justice Gundam]], this unit doesn't possess the combination backpack/flight system unique to the original. However, it is also equipped with a pair of [[leg blade|shin-mounted]] [[energy blade|beam blades]] which are the signature weapons of the [[Infinite Justice Gundam]]. Like its sibling unit, the [[Rising Freedom Gundam]], it is also capable of transforming into a fighter-like form.
other_names: イモータルジャスティスガンダム

title: soyombo
body:
The Soyombo symbol is a special character in the Soyombo alphabet invented by Öndör Gegeen Zanabazar (the first Gelupa of Tibetean [[Buddhism]] in Mongolia) in 1686. The name "Soyombo" is derived from Sanskrit svayambhu "self-created". It serves as a national symbol of [[Mongolia]], to be found on the Flag of Mongolia, the Emblem of Mongolia, and on many other official documents.

The Soyombo may only feature the upper parts in some variation, seen for example in the flag of Agin-Buryat Okrug. 

H4.   𑪞  𑪟  𑪠

title: tree
body:
Perennial woody [[plant]]s, not precisely defined, but distinguished from [[bush|shrub]]s by their size and growth habit. Trees usually have a single unbranched spindle or trunk at some distance from the ground and have a head of [[branch]]es and [[leaf|leaves]]. For the very young version, see [[sapling]].

title: kid_icarus_of_myths_and_monsters
body:
The second game in the [[Kid Icarus]] series and a sequel to the [[kid_icarus_(nes)|NES title]], released for the [[Game Boy]] in 1991 (North America) and 1992 (Europe). 
Despite being developed in Japan, this game would not receive an official release there until 2012, through the [[Nintendo 3DS]] Virtual Console, and it is not acknowledged by [[Kid Icarus Uprising]].

title: aki_rosenthal
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s  [[1st Generation (hololive)|]], she's a half-[[elf]] school girl from another world. Designed by [[Azumi Akitake]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[detached hair|detached]] [[low twintails]]. Her most striking feature is indeed her detached twintails and her [[headgear]], which flips around in response to her emotions.

title: padme_amidala
body:
A [[Star Wars]] character played by [[Natalie Portman]]. She first appeared in [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace |The Phantom Menace]] as the teenage Queen of Naboo, and after her reign, becomes a senator and an anti-war activist in the Galactic Senate. She secretly marries [[Anakin Skywalker]], then later dies while giving birth to twins [[Luke Skywalker]] and [[Princess Leia|Leia Organa]]. Anakin's fear of losing Padmé serves as the catalyst in driving him to the dark side of the Force and becoming [[Darth Vader]].

title: bikini
body:
A bikini is a two-piece swimsuit for women, typically comprising a bra-like top and a panty-like bottom; however, the bottom can also be in the style of a [[bikini skirt]] or [[bikini shorts]].

Bikinis come in a wide range of styles, with most designed to reveal more of the body, especially around the [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]].

The key distinguishing feature of a bikini is that it prominently exposes the [[midriff]], whereas other types of two-piece swimsuits may have a higher waistline and/or a top that extends further to cover the area. However, it's worth noting that most modern two-piece swimsuits are, in fact, bikinis.

If only the bra portion of the bikini is worn, use [[bikini top only]]. Likewise, use [[bikini bottom only]] when only the panty portion is worn. If a character's bikini top and bottom don't match, use [[mismatched bikini]].

title: michael_wittmann
body:
[b]Michael Wittmann[/b] (22 April 1914 – 8 August 1944), also known as [b]The Black Baron[/b], was a notorious and infamous German [[Waffen-SS]] [[tank]] commander and [[Tiger I]] ace from [[World War II]] with 139 confirmed kills.

He died in [[France]] during the 1944 [[Invasion of Normandy]] when his tank was [[ambush]]ed, hit and destroyed by a combined Allied armored force.

h4. See also
* [[Kurt Knispel]]

* [[Tag Group:People]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Michael Wittmann":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Wittmann
other_names: ミハエル・ヴィットマン

title: swimsuit
body:
A garment worn for [[swimming]], [[bathing]], and [[beach]] activities. 

Female swimwear is usually made of tight-fitting stretch fabric, either [[one-piece_swimsuit|one]] or [[bikini|two-piece]].

[[Male swimwear]] typically covers the crotch area only and can be loose ([[swim trunks|trunks]]) or tight-fitting ([[swim briefs|briefs]], [[legskin]], or [[jammers]]).

title: umamusume
body:
[b]Umamusume: Pretty Derby[/b] is a mobile game developed and published by [[Cygames]] featuring [[horse girl|girls]] based on famous [[horse|racehorses]]. The game was first announced in 2016 and was initially slated for a Fall 2018 release, only for development to start out from scratch; with the ultimate release date pushed back to Febuary 2021. On June 21, 2023, a party game spinoff, [i][[Umamusume: Party Dash]][/i], was announced for a 2024 Worldwide.

The franchise received several anime adaptations, with the first season airing before the game's official release in Spring 2018, and a second season launching alongside the game in Winter 2021. A spinoff featuring [[Narita Top Road (Umamusume)|]] was aired for Spring 2023. The third season premiered in Fall 2023, followed by an anime film centered on [[Jungle Pocket (Umamusume)|]] in May 2024. An anime adaptation of the manga [i][[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]][/i] is currently in the works and is slated for a 2025 release.

There is also the [i][[Umayon]][/i] spinoff, which was a 4koma manga that was adapted into an anime short in 2020, and the [i][[Umayuru]][/i] spinoff which was released directly on the [i]Umamusume[/i]'s YouTube channel in Fall 2022.


h4. Anime adaptations
* [i]Umamusume: Pretty Derby[/i] Seasons 1 to 3

title: takamaki_anne
body:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Mizuki Nana]] (JP) / [[Erika Harlacher]] (EN).

A 16-year-old, quarter-American girl who attends Shujin High School. Unable to fit in with those around her due to her noticeably different appearance, she isolates herself within the school. She is often seen hanging out with the [[amamiya ren|protagonist]] and [[Sakamoto Ryuuji]]. Strange rumors about her have seemingly been circulating the school, but whether or not they’re true is currently unknown. Her initial persona is [[Carmen (Persona 5)|]].

title: sweet_lolita
body:
Sweet Lolita or "Amaloli" ( アマーロリ ) is heavily influenced by Rococo styles as well as Victorian and Edwardian children's clothing. Focusing on the child and fantasy aspects of Lolita, the Sweet Lolita style adopts the basic Lolita format and uses lighter colors.

It has all the traditional Lolita elements but with a wider choice of colors, like light pinks, baby blues, whites, and even sometimes colors like lavender, canary yellow and mint green. This is also where you'll find the most fluff and frill.

[b]excerpts from Wikipedia & Lolita Handbook[/b]

h4. See also

* [[Lolita Fashion]]
* [[Gothic Lolita]]
* [[Wa Lolita]]
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

title: classic_lolita
body:
A style of [[Lolita fashion]] heavily based on historical fashion. It tends to have a "mature/elegant" [[Victorian]] look to it.

Skirts in Classic Lolita are usually longer than in Sweet Lolita, and feature motifs such as [[floral print]], crowns, realistic animals, and fine art. Overall, the style tends to have a more sophisticated appearance.

h4. See also
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

title: gothic_lolita
body:
Gothic Lolita (ゴスロリ, "GothLoli", or sometimes "Loli-Goth") is a specific kind of fashion that is a mixture of both [[goth fashion]] and [[Lolita fashion|Lolita styles]]. [[Lolita fashion]] draws much of its inspiration from Rococo, Victorian-style and Edwardian fashion and often aims to imitate the look of Victorian children or porcelain dolls. Gothic Lolita applies the aesthetics of [[goth fashion]] to the childlike, pretty [[Lolita fashion]].

h4. See also

* [[Goth fashion]]
* [[Lolita fashion]]
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gothic Lolita":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_Lolita

title: lolita_fashion
body:
A Japanese fashion style influenced by [[Victorian]] children's clothing as well as costumes from the [[Rococo movement]].

The fashion consists primarily of a knee length [[skirt]] or [[dress]], [[headdress]], [[blouse]], [[petticoat]]/[[crinoline]], [[kneehighs|knee length socks]] or [[thighhighs|stockings]] and rocking horse or [[high_heels|high heel]]/[[platform shoes]]. [[Teddy bear]]s and [[doll]]s are often carried to emphasize the childlike look. 

Please note that [[Lolita fashion]] and [[loli]] are two very different things. [[mature female|Older women]] can be shown wearing these clothes as well.

h4. Substyles

* !post #8152752: [[Classic Lolita]]
* !post #8294345: [[Gothic Lolita]]
* !post #8091154: [[Qi Lolita]]
* !post #7646406: [[Sweet Lolita]]
* !post #8014429: [[Wa Lolita]]

ロリータファッション

title: wa_lolita
body:
A fashion style that combines traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]] with [[Lolita fashion]]. It usually consists of a [[yukata]] (sometimes [[kimono]]) top and a [[skirt]], or the bottom half of the garment is altered to mimic the typical Lolita style.

The name originates from the reference to Japan as "The Land of Wa" (harmony).

For Chinese-inspired Lolita, see [[qi Lolita]].

For Japanese maid outfits, see [[wa maid]].

h4. See also

* [[Gothic Lolita]]
* [[Kimono skirt]]
* [[Kimono]]
* [[Yukata]]
* [[Short kimono]]
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

title: arm_garter
body:
An elastic band worn around the upper arm. Originally, this was to allow for adjusting a sleeves length to better fit the wearer, or to hold up very long gloves that have a loose fit around the arm, but they have since become a decorative band on their own.

On Danbooru, arm garters usually look like [[frilled thigh strap]] but are worn like an [[armband]], and are not used to hold up a sleeve.  If they're worn over sleeves, then use the [[sleeve garter]] tag.

h4. Example

title: checkered_clothes
body:
Clothing with a [[checkered]] pattern, which is a series of uniform, repeating squares that alternate between two colors in a [b]diagonal[/b] arrangement. The most popular pairing is black and white, but many other combinations exist.

Not to be confused with [[plaid]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Check (pattern)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Check_(pattern)]

title: ascalon
body:
[[huge_weapon|Huge]] [[sword]] weilded by [[Acqua of the Back]].
Ascalon or Great Sword Ascalon is a giant sword, given to Acqua by the Astrological Surgery Brigade. It is based on the legend of St. George, specifically the holy sword he wielded to slay a [[dragon]].

title: frilled_thigh_strap
body:
A [[frills|frilly]] [[thigh strap]] composed typically of an elastic band. Often associated with [[lingerie]] or bridal wear.

This tag is for decorative garters worn by themselves, not the kind used to hold up a pair of [[thighhighs]]. See [[legwear garter]] for the type of garters used to hold up [[thighhighs]]. See [[frilled thighhighs]] for thighhighs with built-in frilled bands around the top.

title: amane_kanata_(another_world)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]], it was debuted during her 3rd anniversary 3D live concert [i]"Another World"[/i] and has a [[fallen angel]] theme.

It consists of a [[black collar|black]] [[animal collar]], an  [[o-ring top|o-ring]] [[chest harness|chest]] [[o-ring harness|harness]] a [[black bra|black]] [[lace-trimmed bra|lace-trimmed]] [[strapless bra]], multiple [[arm strap|arm]] and [[wrist straps]] on her right arm and [[bandaged arm|bandages]] on her left arm, [[black gloves]], a large [[black belt]] with a large [[blue rose]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[layered skirt]] with a [[gold trim]]med [[black skirt|black]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]]-length layers, and a layered [[overskirt]] with a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] layer and a [[torn skirt|torn]] blue layer, a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[blue thighhighs|blue thighhigh]] on her right leg an a [[heart o-ring|heart]] [[o-ring thigh strap]] and an [[ankle garter]]/[[anklet]] on her left leg, and [[black footwear|black]] [[pumps]].

Fitting with the fallen angel theme her halo is now [[blue halo|dark blue]], her [[colored inner hair]] is a darker shade of [[blue hair|blue]] and has a dark [[purple hair|purple]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], her [[streaked hair|hair streaks]] are also purple now too and her wings are now darker with the [[gradient wings|gradient]] going from [[grey wings|grey]] to [[blue wings|dark blue]] and she has an [[multiple wings|additional]] pair of [[black wings]] pointing down.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[long hair]] done in a [[half updo]] with [[double bun]]s.

title: mycelium
body:
White rootlike or weblike structures that comprise the "body" of [[mushroom]]s and other fungi, analogous to the tree and roots of a fruit tree, whereas the mushroom is the fruit. Typically seen alongside mushrooms.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mycelium":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mycelium]

title: wolf_o'donnell
body: Recurring character in [[Star Fox]], rival to [[Fox McCloud]] and leader of Star Wolf.

title: fly_agaric
body:
A large red-capped [[mushroom]] with white spots, also known by its scientific name [i]Amanita muscaria[/i]. Its distinctive features have made it the iconic toadstool in popular culture, notably as the inspiration for [[power-up|power-up]]s in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. It is a known hallucinogen but can be made edible by boiling.

title: list_of_fate_series_characters
body:
This is a compilation of all tagged characters, weapons, and other miscellaneous terms seen in the [[fate (series)|Fate series]], a mixed-media project developed by Type-Moon. All tags will be listed in the first entry they appear in to avoid redundancy. Servants will also have any related weapons, alternate forms, and/or Noble Phantasms (essentially a powerful attack the Servant can use) listed beneath that Servant's name.

title: pikachu
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #025 in the National Pokédex, an Electric type.

A yellow mouse-like Pokémon, and the mascot of the [[Pokemon|Pokémon]] franchise. It evolves from [[Pichu]], and evolves into [[Raichu]].

In the [[Pokemon (anime)|Pokemon anime]], Pikachu is the signature Pokémon of [[Ash Ketchum]]. They are voiced primarily by [[Ootani Ikue]] in the anime.

Pikachu is playable in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series.

title: fat_pikachu
body:
A [[Pikachu]] as depicted with its original, plumper proportions. Described by original designer [[Nishida Atsuko]] as "dumpling-shaped", with the defining trait being the lack of a clear separation point between the head and the rest of the body.

[[Gigantamax Pikachu]] is based on this version. Sometimes also depicted with a white (or darker yellow) belly and a tail similar to [[Raichu]]'s - this design is based on its sprite from [[Pokemon RGBY|Pokémon Red & Green]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3845057: Fat Pikachu
* !post #7574498: Modern Pikachu

title: march_7th_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]], voiced by [[Ogura Yui]]. Named after the day she was found frozen in an iceberg by the [[astral express (honkai: star rail)|Astral Express]] crew members, she has ice powers and likes to take photos.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[pink hair]], [[pink eyes|pink]][[two-tone eyes|-and-]][[blue eyes]] with [[pink pupils]], and [[medium breasts]].

title: nai_diffusion
body: An artificial intelligence that creates [[AI-generated]] images from text-based prompts.

title: ai-generated
body:
h6. Uploading fully AI-generated art to Danbooru is against the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]]; see forum #223144.

An image that, rather than being drawn by a human artist, was generated by an artificial intelligence program.

This tag applies to [b]fully AI-generated[/b] images, that is, images that underwent no edits or extremely minor retouchings. For edited images, see [[AI-assisted]].
Note that AI-assisted posts that are up to Danbooru's standards are exempt from the ban on AI-generated art.

h4. Examples of common AI model outputs
* !post #7404815: [[Stable Diffusion]] anime
* !post #6387617: [[Stable Diffusion]] anime
* !post #5851580: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv1]]
* !post #7096638: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv3]]
* !asset #24887514: [[nai_diffusion|NovelAIv4]]
* !post #7173141: [[Midjourney|nijijourney]] 
* !post #7402576: [[Midjourney]]
* !post #7634318: [[dall-e|DALL·E 3]]

h4. Identification

Signs that something may be AI-generated:

* Anything in {{width:512 height:768|512×768}} or {{width:768 height:512|768×512}} resolution. This is a very common resolution for Stable Diffusion 1.5-based models, and it is rarely used by humans.
** Anything in {{width:832 height:1216|832×1216}} or {{width:1216 height:832|1216×832}} resolution. This is a very common resolution for Stable Diffusion XL-based models.
* High quality art in low resolution, less than 1000×1000. Older AI generators are restricted to low resolutions, whereas skilled artists normally use much higher resolutions. AI art may be [[upscaled]] to higher resolution, but this can produce artifacts. 
** Newer models are capable of higher resolution, such as NovelAI starting at a free tier of 1024×1024.
* EXIF metadata in the file indicating it is AI-generated. For example, AI prompts or model names. On the upload page, you can click the filesize beneath the image to see the EXIF metadata. Danbooru will automatically tag [[AI-generated]] after upload if the metadata indicates it is AI-generated.
* A certain generic-looking art style with a generic background. This is typical of anime-styled images generated by NovelAI and Stable Diffusion. Browse {{AI-generated status:deleted}} to get a feel for this.
* Abnormal/unusual mistakes within the artwork, such as:
** [[Anatomical nonsense]], such as extra legs (post #5732513), fused fingers (post #5742855), fused legs (post #5735212), etc.
** Strangely drawn objects/environments such as a book with it's cover as another layer of pages (post #5738243), wooden floor conforming with the shape of a character's hair (post #5850417), poor line continuity/object permanence when an object is hidden or goes behind other objects (post #5779922), etc.
** Note that [[bad hands]] or other mistakes are not in themselves signs of AI-generation, as humans can make mistakes too. The errors made by AI tend to be completely illogical or physically impossible things that no human would draw.
* A brand new artist pumping out improbably large volumes of high quality-looking art in a short period of time. This isn't automatically a sign of AI-generation, as sometimes new artists may release a pre-prepared portfolio of artwork to establish their presence.
* An artist with an illogically drastic change in art style after early-October 2022 (around the time NovelAI became popular). This can easily be seen with artists with a low quality art style suddenly shifting into the generic-looking artstyle typical of NovelAI. Bear in mind that artstyles of skilled artists can evolve and improve over time.
* No [[signature]], [[watermark]], or [[web address]]. Human artists often (but not always) sign their work, while AI works are often unsigned, as older AI models can't produce legible text, let alone realistic signatures. Do note however, that some AI artists may add a signature or watermark after the image is generated.
* Mentions of "AI" or common AI generators such as "Nijijourney," "Midjourney," "NovelAI," or "Stable Diffusion" in the tags or description of a post are a good place to start, but should not be used to automatically assume [[AI-generated|AI-generation]] (see below).
** [b]Note:[/b] Artists frequently use AI keywords when prohibiting their work for its use, so be careful when making assumptions based on them.
 

If you are unsure whether a post is AI-generated or not, ask in topic #22285.

h4. Known AI models

* [[DALL-E]]
* [[Midjourney]]
* [[Stable Diffusion]]
* [[nai diffusion|NovelAI Diffusion]]

h4. See also

* [[AI-Generated art (topic)]]
* [[AI Angry Dr. Mario (Meme)]]
* [[AI Drawing Anime Characters Eating Ramen (Meme)]]
* [[AI Drawing Person in Cake (Meme)]]
* [[Gaming Penis Ikebana (Meme)]]
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]
h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Artificial intelligence art":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence_art]
* "NovelAI":[https://novelai.net/]
* "Civitai":[https://civitai.com/]
* "Aibooru":[https://aibooru.online/]

title: gardevoir
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #282 in the National Pokédex, a Psychic/Fairy-type (Pure Psychic-type before [[pokemon xy|Pokémon X/Y]]). Evolves from [[Kirlia]] (from [[Ralts]]).

Dangerously feminine, it sports a green [[bob cut]], and a dress-like fabric covers the lower half of its slim body. Often further personified in fanart, it is precariously either gender in equal probability (read: [[otoko no ko]]).

Japanese name: Sirnight

title: spider-man_(toei)
body:
A 1978 live-action [[tokusatsu]] show loosely based on the [i][[spider-man_(series)|Spider-Man]][/i] series, produced by Toei Company, Ltd. The series follows a man named [[Yamashiro Takuya]], who transforms into the titular "Emissary from Hell" to fight villains with his [[mecha]] [[Leopardon]].

Toei would later reuse the concept of heroes and mecha for [i][[Super Sentai]][/i] series that would follow this show.

This series' version of Spider-Man made an appearance in the [i]Spider-Verse[/i] comic events, and is slated to appear in the sequel to [i][[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]][/i]. He's also frequently referred to by fans as [i]Supaidaman[/i].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man (Japanese TV series)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_(Japanese_TV_series)

title: spider-man
body:
[b]Spider-Man[/b] is a fictional [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] superhero. The character was created by writer-editor [[Stan Lee]] and writer-artist Steve Ditko. He first appeared in [i]Amazing Fantasy[/i] #15 (Aug. 1962).

[[Peter Parker]] was orphaned at the age of six when his parents were killed in an airplane crash overseas. He went to live with his uncle and aunt; Ben and May Parker, in Forest Hills, [[New York City]]. Parker was extremely bright and became a high honors student at Midtown High School. Parker's shyness and scholastic interest often made him a social outcast. 

While attending a public exhibition demonstrating the safe handling of nuclear laboratory waste materials sponsored by the General Techtronics Corporation, Peter was bitten by a spider which had been irradiated by a particle accelerator used in the demonstration. Making his way home afterwards, Peter discovered he had somehow gained incredible strength, agility, and the ability to cling to walls; spider-like traits that he immediately associated with the spider bite. 

In the 1970s, he was given his own [[tokusatsu]] [[spider-man (toei)|series]] in Japan where he had a [[mecha]] ([[Leopardon]]).

On [[Nijiura]], he shares a flat with [[Astaroth (Shinrabanshou)]], [[WE-tan]], and [[Yamada-san]].

h4. See also
* [[Iron Spider Armor]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man
other_names: スパイダーマン(キャラクター)

title: magma_seijin
body:
An alien from [[Ultraman Leo (series)|]].

[spoiler]He's responsible for the destruction of [[Ultraman Leo]]'s home planet, Nebula L77, as well as injuring [[Ultraseven]], damaging his [[Ultra Eye]], rendering him unable to transform.[/spoiler]

title: soldier_boy_(the_boys)
body:
A fictional superhero character from [[The Boys]].

[b]Soldier Boy[/b] is a [[parody]] of [[Captain America]], but more brutal, sadistic and with severe [[PTSD]].

He has super human strength and resilience and is armed with a [[m1911]], a Bowie [[knife]] and a very heavy Titanium [[shield]]. He wears a [[superhero costume]]. In the TV show Soldier Boy also has the ability to produce a very destructive high [[radiation]] energy blast [spoilers]that can remove compound V from any superpowered individual's body, turning them into regular people[/spoilers].

title: valkie_seijin
body: A race of aliens from [[Ultraman Tarou (Series)|]].

title: billy_butcher
body:
One of the main characters of [[The Boys]].
Butcher is portrayed by [[Karl Urban]] in the Amazon adaptation.

title: batman_(1966)
body: Batman is an American live-action television series based on the [[DC Comics]] character of the same name. It stars [[Adam West]] as [[Bruce Wayne]]/[[Batman]] and Burt Ward as [[Dick Grayson]]/Robin—two crime-fighting heroes who defend Gotham City from a variety of archvillains. It is known for its camp style and upbeat theme music, as well as its intentionally humorous, simplistic morality aimed at its preteen audience.

title: baltan_seijin
body:
A race of [[crustacean]]-like aliens from [[Ultraman (1st series)|]]. One of the most popular alien races from the franchise, often compared to the [[Dalek]]s from [[Doctor Who]]. Due to their popularity, and the wishes of their creator, Toshihiro Iijima, they've largely been phased out of antagonistic roles.

title: gomusin
body: Gomusin are traditional [[korean_clothes|Korean]] [[shoes]] made of rubber that are wide, with low heels with the toe slightly upturned and colored a different color from the rest of the shoe. Typically worn together with [[hanbok]]s, but not all shoes worn with hanbok are gomusin.

title: takane_lui
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive]]'s 6th generation "holoX" Designed by [[Kakage]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] with [[pink wings|same-colored]] [[head wings]], [[blue eyes]] (which she can turn [[orange eyes|orange]] with [[crosshair pupils]]), and [[large breasts]]. She also has [[long legs]] and [[wide hips]] with a noticeable [[thigh gap]] which gives her a very particular silhouette that some fans compare to a tuning fork.
Her default hairstyle is [[short hair|short]] [[parted hair]] held with a [[black hairband]] and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair_between_eyes|between her eyes]].

Artists sometimes depict her as a [[Takane Lui (hawk)|hawk]] (especially in HOLOTORI group arts), and a bald eagle.

She is sometimes seen accompanied by her partner/caretaker, [[Ganmo (takane lui)|]] the [[frogmouth]], and two younglings: a smaller chick with one feather-ahoge named [[Tsumire (takane lui)|]], and a slightly larger chick with three feather-ahoges named [[Tsukune (takane lui)|]].

title: leonard_mccoy
body:
Character from [[Star Trek: The Original Series]] and [i]Star Trek: The Animated Series[/i], played by [[DeForest Kelley]].

The chief surgeon of the [[USS Enterprise]], known for his quick temper (Especially when he is dealing with [[Spock]]) and no-nonsense demeanor. His signature phrase, "I'm a doctor, not a X!", has attained longtime [[meme]]tic status in the Western science fiction fandom.

A decade after Kelley's death, [[Karl Urban]] assumed the role of McCoy in the [[star trek (2009)|Star Trek reboot film]] in 2009.

title: ishmael_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.08 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named after the narrator of the 19th century novel "Moby-Dick.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moby-Dick

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[orange hair]], [[green eyes]], [[freckles]], and wears a [[headband]] made of rope with 2 [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]]s. She wears the uniform of all Limbus Company sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[belt]], [[black pants]], but has a [[torn coat|torn]] [[black coat]] the length of a [[jacket]] instead of the standard [[black coat]]. 

She wields both a [[shield]] and [[flanged mace]] in her base identity with the English word 'Hearse' written on the shield. Her rope headband is consistent across all of her identities, although sometimes wearing it as a [[hairband]] or attaching it to her weapon instead of wearing it.

Sometimes drawn with [[tentacle hair]] due to a certain prerelease artwork (post #7489139).

title: captain_america
body:
A [[Marvel]] superhero created by legendary comic book artists Joe Simon and Jack Kirby.

[b]Captain America[/b], real name [[Steve Rogers]], used to be a skinny, short soldier who was given a serum during [[World War II]] that bestowed him with super human physical abilities above the peak of human potential. He is easily identified by his red-white-and-blue [[superhero costume]] and similarly designed circular shield which is made of Vibranium, a fictional metal that is rare and can reflect any and all attacks.

He is one of the most recognized members of [[Avengers (series)|The Avengers]].

h4. See also
* [[Soldier Boy (The Boys)]]

title: gat_(hat)
body:
A gat, also called a heuklip [tn](lit. [i]black hat[/i])[/tn], is a type of Korean traditional hat; until the 19th century, it was worn only by noblemen. They are cylindrical in shape with a wide brim (양태) on a bamboo frame (모자). Compare to the Western [[top hat]].

Though most gat are black, some variations exist. White gat were exclusively for funerals. Red gat were worn by military officials.

The dangling accessory is called gatkuen.

A variant made from bamboo is called the [[paeraengi]].

h4. Examples

body:
A [[bra]] or [[bikini]] top that has no shoulder straps or side bands, instead being held on only by adhesive. Also called a sticky bra, stick-on bra, or a NuBra, after the original brand name.

In real life, adhesive bras are designed to be worn with [[strapless]], [[backless dress]]es. In fanart, they're more often worn by themselves or as part of a [[revealing clothes|revealing outfit]].

title: vanguard_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] battleship HMS [i]Vanguard[/i] (23). Character design by [[Ask (askzy)]], voiced by [[Nakashima Yuki]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white dress]], [[white cape]] with green inside color, white [[thighhighs]], [[black footwear]], black [[hair ribbon]], and [[black gloves]]. Her [[rigging]] is a large and elaborate setup akin to the French factions, sporting her four historical 381 mm twin gun mounts and two 13.3 cm twin DP secondary mounts.

From her voice lines, she is implied to be an [[otaku]], made more apparent with "her gacha build obtain animation":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=smcvah3Sqp8] that resembles a [i]mahou shoujo[/i] transformation sequence. 

In real life, [i]Vanguard[/i] was the Royal Navy's largest and fastest battleship (45,000 tons and 30 knots), but was the last British battleship built and commissioned. She was built to a modified [i]Lion[/i]-class design meant to take in Courageous' and [[Glorious (Azur Lane)|]]' original 381 mm guns in storage to expedite construction. She was launched in 1944, commissioned in 1946, and sold for scrap in 1960.



h4. Skins

* !post #5383063: [[Vanguard (Half-Hearted Masquerade) (Azur Lane)|Half-Hearted Masquerade]]

* "Wikipedia: HMS [i]Vanguard[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Vanguard_(23)]

title: qalaisa_(arknights)
body:
A formerly unnamed Sarkaz woman from the fourth [[Arknights]] Integrated Strategies, [i]Expeditioner's Jǫklumarkar[/i], or just "IS4".

She first appears in the encounter node "Northwind Witch" that triggers a battle, similar to those of:

* An unidentified Cautus's encounter node "Damsel in Distress" in IS1, [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i].
* [[Chained Sarkaz Girl]]'s encounter node "Shackled Bloodline" in IS2, [i]Crimson Solitaire[/i].
* [[Dancing Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Dancing Chests" in IS3, [i]Mizuki & Caerula Arbor[/i].
* [[Praying Sankta Nun (arknights)|]]'s encounter node "The Pious Worshiper" from IS5, [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables[/i].

She was later introduced as an NPC in the Story Collection "A Kazdelian Rescue". Her real name, Qalaiša, was revealed in the web event acting as a teaser to IS5.

Typically has [[black horns]], [[black hair]], overall [[black clothes]] with a [[white ribbon]] and one visible white [[earrings|earring]] with [[pointy ears]], [[blue eyes]], and has what appears to be a black [[picnic basket]].
other_names: 北風の魔女(アークナイツ)

title: chained_sarkaz_girl
body:
An unnamed Sarkaz girl from the second [[Arknights]] Integrated Strategies, "Crimson Solitaire", or just "IS2". She also makes a cameo in IS5.

She first appears in the encounter node "Shackled Bloodline" that triggers a battle, similar to those of:

* An unidentified Cautus's encounter node "Damsel in Distress" in IS1, [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i].
* [[Dancing Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Dancing Chests" in IS3, [i]Mizuki & Caerula Arbor[/i].
* [[Qalaisa (arknights)|Basket Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Northwind Witch" from IS4, [i]Expeditioner's Jǫklumarkar[/i].
* [[Praying Sankta Nun (arknights)|]]'s encounter node "The Pious Worshiper" from IS5, [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables[/i].

Typically has [[red eyes]] [u][[eyes visible through hair|visible through]][/u] [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], which are tied in [u][[twintails]][/u], and [u][[black earrings]][/u] on her [[pointy ears]]. She wears a [u][[short dress|short]][/u] [[see-through dress|see-through]] [[black dress]] with a [u][[floral print]][/u], a [u][[black ascot]][/u] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs|kneehigh socks]]. [u]Both her dress and legwear are [[asymmetrical clothes|asymmetrical]][/u]: the see-trough part of the dress continues as a sleeve on her left arm with multiple [[arm strap]]s, while her right one is [[single bare arm|bare]]. Her right leg is covered by the see-through cloth as a [[single pantsleg]], while her left one is [[single_bare_leg |bare]] with two [[thigh strap]]s.
Her [[black horns|black]] [[demon horns]] are [u]curvier at the base[/u] and she is often depicted with [u][[cuffs]] chained a [[pillar]][/u].
[tn]To avoid misidentification with IS3's Dancing Sarkaz Ladt, the Chained Girl's distinguished features have been underlined.[/tn]
other_names: 束縛された血族(アークナイツ)

title: praying_sankta_nun_(arknights)
body:
An unnamed Sankta nun from the fifth [[Arknights]] Integrated Strategies, [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables[/i], or just "IS5".

She first appears in the encounter node "The Pious Worshiper" that triggers a battle, similar to those of:

* An unidentified Cautus's encounter node "Damsel in Distress" in IS1, [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i].
* [[Chained Sarkaz Girl]]'s encounter node "Shackled Bloodline" in IS2, [i]Crimson Solitaire[/i].
* [[Dancing Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Dancing Chests" in IS3, [i]Mizuki & Caerula Arbor[/i].
* [[Qalaisa (arknights)|Basket Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Northwind Witch" from IS4, [i]Expeditioner's Jǫklumarkar[/i].

Typically has [[gradient hair]] from [[grey hair|grey]] to [[white hair|white]] with [[hair intakes|intakes]], covered by a [[see-through veil|see-through]] [[black veil]], with a [[white halo]] and [[glowing wings|glowing]] [[detached wings]]. She wears a [[black capelet]], [[lace-trimmed thighhighs|lace-trimmed]] [[white thighhighs]] with [[frilled thighhighs|frills]] and a [[long dress|long]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[black dress]] with a [[pelvic curtain]], held by [[yellow belt|yellow]] [[chain belt]] and a [[black belt|black]] [[chest belt]]. Finally, she can be see [[holding rosary|holding]] a [[rosary]] with her [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

title: 16personalities
body:
A website that offers personality tests based on the [[Myers-Briggs Type Indicator]] model.

They have color-coded designs for every personality type, which are then often used as bases for character creation by artists.
If a character based on an MBTI type doesn't take cues or inspiration from these designs, [[original]] would be better suited.

title: shrieker_(armored_core)
body: An [[Armored Core]] [[mecha]] featured in the 2024 animated series [[Secret Level (series)|]]. Operated by an augmented pilot known as [b]The Pilot[/b], played by [[Keanu Reeves]], the SHRIEKER's design is a mixture of [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon|Balam's MELANDER frame]] with the [[armored core: for answer|Bernard and Felix Foundation's 063AN and the Omer TYPE-LAHIRE]]. The mech is infamous due to one scene in Secret Level where [spoilers]The Pilot kills an enemy pilot by using SHRIEKER's finger to kill the pilot in their cockpit[/spoilers].

She wears [u][[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]][/u] and a [u][[long dress|long]][/u] [[see-through dress|see-through]] [[black dress]], from which a [[red tail|red]] [[demon tail]] comes out. title: sweet_potato
body:
Also called a camote, it is a type of tuber vegetable that isn't as starchy as the [[potato]], but instead has a sweeter taste. Tends to be mislabeled as a yam, but they are from an entirely different botanical species. This is also known as a food that makes you gassy. Hence why you see many artists draw [[fart]] illustrations as part of the gag.

In [[Mexico]], [[Bolivia]], [[Peru]], [[Chile]], Central America, and the [[Philippines]], the sweet potato is known as camote

Popularly associated with [[Aki Minoriko]] because she wears a sweet potato-scented perfume, and has a spellcard named after them in [[Mountain of Faith]].

[[Chiyoda_(kancolle)|Chiyoda]] of Kancolle fame is also pretty fond of them.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[roasted sweet potato]]
* [[sweet potato cake]]

title: narukami_yuu
body:
The protagonist of [[Persona 4]]. Nephew of [[Doujima Ryoutarou]] and cousin/big brother figure of [[Doujima Nanako]].

Originally nameless in the video game, he is given the name "Seta Souji" in the manga adaptation and "Narukami Yuu" in the anime adaptation.

He is nicknamed [[Banchou]] for a number of reasons:
* His starting Persona, [[Izanagi (persona 4)|]], wears a banchou-style outfit ([[gakuran]] and tall [[geta]])
* In the Miss? Contest, he dresses as a [[sukeban]]
* Compared to the protagonist of [[Persona 3]], [[Yuuki Makoto (persona 3)|]], he has a number of much more manly conversation/action choices

This nickname gained official acknowledgement in the PV for [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena]], in which he is called the "steel siscon banchou" (鋼のシスコン番長).

Voiced by: [[Namikawa Daisuke]] (Japanese), [[Johnny Yong Bosch]] (English)

title: adachi_tooru
body:
A character from [i][[Persona 4]][/i].

Adachi is a laid-back detective who works as an assistant to [[Doujima Ryoutarou]].

Adachi has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. He usually wears a [[business suit]] that consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[red necktie]], [[black jacket]] with [[long sleeves]], [[brown belt]], [[black pants]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

Often seen buying [[cabbage]], which while not something he likes, eats because it is cheap.

title: ruru_amour
body:
[[HUGtto! Precure]] antagonist. An android, and part-time worker for Criasu Corporation. She disguises herself as Ruru Amour and infiltrates the Cures' school, but leaves the Corporation and joins the heroine as a fellow Cure - [[Cure Amour]].

h4. See also

* [spoiler][[Ruru Amour (young)]][/spoiler]

title: ruru_amour_(young)
body: [spoiler]An [[aged down]] version of [[Ruru Amour]], as seen in the final episode of [[Hugtto! Precure]].[/spoiler]

title: self-doubt_animal_(futsuu_no_keion-bu)
body: A small grey [[tapir]]-looking animal symbolizing [[Hatono Chihiro]]'s self-doubt in [[Futsuu no Keion-bu]].

title: andou_tamaki
body:
[[Andou Tamaki]] is a female character from [[Ange Vierge]].
She has a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[brown hair]] set in a [[single hair bun]]. She also, normally, wears [[glasses]].

title: celestia_(ange_vierge)
body:
[[celestia_(ange_vierge)|Celestia]] is a female character from [[Ange Vierge]].
She has [[pointy ears]], [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]].

title: dragon_li_cat
body:
The Dragon Li is a recently established Chinese breed of domestic [[cat]].

Dragon Li have ears that are relatively close together, medium in size, with broad ear roots and deep earlobes; wide cheeks; large and bright eyes, almond-shaped; brick-red nose with a nose line; moderate body size, wide and deep chest cavity; moderate length of limbs and tail, strong and muscular, with a strong sense of muscle; spotted forehead; black foot pads and paw hair; fur color is usually brown or dark brown, with some white fur on some Dragon Li cats' bodies. Because of its pure yellow striped pattern, it is also known as the yellow tabby cat or tiger-striped cat.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dragon Li":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Li]

title: philia_grenhart
body:
[[Philia Grenhart]] is a female character from [[Ange Vierge]].
She has [[green eyes]] and [[blonde hair]] set in a [[very long hair|very long]], [[high ponytail]], as well as [[long bangs|long]] [[hair between eyes|hair between her eyes]] and an [[ahoge]].
other_names: フィーリア・グレンハルト

title: wilson_gerecke_(ethan_forsythe)
body: Original character from [[Ethan Forsythe]]'s series "Akagi²":[/pools/15941]. Hailing from the Eagle Union, he is the base's current chaplain, attending to the religious needs of the base personnel, much to the disapproval from some (e.g. the Iris Libre).

title: amiya_(arknights)
body:
[i]Amiya, leader of Rhodes Island, will fight alongside you.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

The public face and one of the top executives of Rhodes Island. Although she appears to be a young and inexperienced girl, she is universally trusted and highly qualified for her position. She is the first person the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]] sees when they wake up from their cryosleep at the beginning of the story.

She appear to be a young girl between the ages of 14-15 years old, with [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[blue ascot]], [[miniskirt]] and Rhodes Island [[Jacket]] in her official character design.

Her ears are meant to resemble those of a [[rabbit ears|rabbit]]. However, due to the way those ears are drawn, many fans joke that "she looks like a donkey":[/pools/18086]. 

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

h4. Profile

[expand]
"Doctor, I'm so glad that we're back together. And we'll walk this path together! I've got your back if you've got mine."
- Amiya

title: the_pose
body:
When a character [[lying|lies]] flat [[on stomach|on their stomach]] with their [[feet up]] in the air.

This is usually done to show off a character's [[breasts]], [[ass]], and [[feet]] all at the same time. The subject can be [[no shoes|wearing legwear]] or [[barefoot]], but their [[feet]] must be visible as this is a term coined by foot fetish enthusiasts to describe a particular pose that shows off the feet.

h4. Example

* !post #8857540

h4. See also

* [[feet]]

title: deformed
body:
Used if proportions of characters are deliberately simplified, making them look chibi-esque. This usually means that the body is proportional overall, unlike traditional chibis where the head appears bigger than or the same size as the body. 

For super deformed characters where the head is almost the same size as the body, use the [[chibi]] tag instead.

h5. Examples
* !post #136389
* !post #7941095



h4.See also

* [[chibi]]

body:

title: chicago_fire
body:
Chicago Fire Football Club is an American professional soccer club based in the city of Chicago. The club competes in [[Major League Soccer]] (MLS) as a member of the Eastern Conference. The Fire play their home games at Soldier Field, which they share with the Chicago Bears of the National Football League (NFL).

title: ange_vierge
body:
[b]Ange Vierge[/b] was a trading [[card game]], originally intended to serve as the core of a multimedia franchise. An animated adaptation aired Jul 10, 2016 to Sep 25, 2016. Development of the card game and wider property was discontinued in April of 2017, with the mobile title lingering until 2021.

One aspect to note is that Kadokawa, the franchise's publisher, held several card design contests over the course of the franchise's primary run. A number of the pieces from these contests are preserved on Danbooru, even when they were taken down from Pixiv and elsewhere.

title: sayori_(doki_doki_literature_club)
body:
Sayori is a character in [[Doki Doki Literature Club]]. She is the [[protagonist (doki doki literature club)|]]'s childhood friend, and is generally cheerful and upbeat, though she has her own personal struggles.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair|pinkish]]-[[brown hair|brown]] hair, in which she wears a [[red]] [[hair bow]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her outerwear consists of [[grey jacket]], [[white shirt]] with [[red]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[brown vest]]. Below she wears [[blue skirt]] and [[white socks]]. 

Her loungewear consists of a [[pink shirt]] and [[denim shorts]].

title: aesc_(fate)
body:
Old English for "[b]ash tree[/b]", alternatively known as [b]Tonelico[/b] in the original Japanese.

The savior in the legend of Faerie Britain in Lostbelt no. 6, Avalon le Fae. [spoilers]She is the Lostbelt's [[Morgan le Fay (Fate)|]] before she gave up her ideal of saving the Faeries after countless betrayals and turns into the tyrannical Lostbelt Queen when Chaldea arrives.[/spoilers]

Her appearance is almost identical to that of [[Artoria Caster (second ascension) (fate)|Artoria Caster's second Ascension]], [spoilers]as they both originated as Faeries of Avalon[/spoilers]. The most prominent differences are the color of the bow holding up her [[capelet]] being [[black bow|black]] instead of [[blue bow|blue]]/[[purple bow|purple]] and the staff she holds not being the [[Staff of Selection (fate)|]]. Other differences include the design & color of the [[brooch]] on the bow, the size of the bow on the back of her hat, and the design on the side of her hat, though not all of these may be incorporated in illustrations. [spoiler]Her summonable form's [[aesc (savior) (fate)|second Ascension]] also resembles [[Artoria Caster (third Ascension) (Fate)|Artoria Caster's third Ascension]] for similar reasons.[/spoiler]

She is designed by [[Takeuchi Takashi]] and voiced by [[Ishikawa Yui]].

* !post #4655854: Comparison of Artoria Caster (left) with Aesc (right).

body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' first generation. Character design by [[Nekotokage]]. Also shares the same designer with [[Poette Evergreen]] from the same generation.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[green eyes]], along with a [[brown hat|brown]] [[cowboy hat]] on top of her head.

Her outfit consists of a [[pink bandana]] with a [[cow print]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[front-tie top|front-tie shirt]], a [[navel piercing]], [[brown shorts|brown]] [[ripped shorts]], [[pink leg warmers]] and [[brown boots|brown]] [[thigh boots]] with [[leopard print]]. Fitting to her name, she [[holding lasso|carries a lasso]].


h4. Appearance

* !asset #23285452: Profile

title: riding_crop
body:
A short, semi-rigid whip without a lash. Normally used for horse riding, but nowadays more often associated with BDSM.

Riding crops are often confused with teachers' [[pointer]]s.  A riding crop usually has some flex to it, is usually black in color, and often widens and flattens into a rectangular shape at its very tip. Pointers usually are completely rigid and smoothly taper to a point. Even artists sometimes conflate the two: teacher characters are regularly depicted holding a riding crop when it makes no sense for them to be doing so besides fetish appeal. This is particularly noticeable for [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Katori (kancolle)|]].

h4. See also

* [[Whip]]
* [[BDSM]]
* [[Tag Group:Sex Objects]]

title: sega_master_system
body:
The [b]SG-1000 Mark III[/b] (エスジー・セン [i]Esujī Sen III[/i]), also known as the [b]Sega Game 1000 Mark III[/b] or the [b]Sega Master System[/b], is a cartridge based [[video game]] home [[game_console|console]] manufactured by [[SEGA]] and first released in Japan, Australia, USA, Europe, Brazil and other countries in the mid 80s. 

The Master System was released in the USA in June 1986 and a year later in Japan as the [[Sega Mark III]]. It was a third-generation console produced as a redesign and improvement of a previous console called the [[Sega SG-1000 II]]. It was capable of using regular [[game cartridge]]s as well as smaller-sized Sega Cards which held less memory, but quickly became unpopular in favor of cartridges.

While having low sales in Japan and even less in the USA (and losing against the [[Nintendo]] [[Famicom]]/[[NES]] in those countries), the console proved extremely popular in Europe (with more than 6 million units purchased in the early 90s) and is still being sold in South America. 

[[Brazil]] is still the longest lasting market for the Master System. Tectoy, Sega's distributor in Brazil, is still responsible for marketing, sales and producing original games for it. Several different models of the console have been released in that country during the past decades. These are the Master System I, II, III (and a white colored relaunch version from the 2000s), the cordless Master System Compact, the pink Master System Girl, etc. All the existing [[Sega Game Gear]] games have been also ported to the system by Tectoy.

In 2009 and 2011, two variants of the Master System Evolution, a new console version successor to the Master System III that included 132 built-in games, were released only in Brazil. Another system called the Master System Portable which is a yellow gamepad with 30 built-in games has also been released recently by Tectoy.

The Sega Master System was succeded by the [[Sega Mega Drive]] in the early 80s.

h4.See also
* [[SEGA Light Phaser]]
* [[List of game consoles]]
* [[Tag Group:Video Game]]

h4.External links

* Wikipedia: "Master System":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_System

title: va-1ss
body:
A fictional transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction anime series. 

It first appeared in the [[Macross 2]] OVA from 1992.

The [b]VA-1SS Metal Siren[/b] is an advanced and very powerful combat-capable prototype [[variable fighter]]. 

It is armed with an experimental "EMP (Electro Magnetic Pulse) anti-capital ship device":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromagnetic_pulse, missiles, and many energy weapons.

title: kilo_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. She is unique in that she fights while piloting a [[mecha]], a sentient robot of her own design named [[talos (nikke)|T.A.L.O.S.]]. In her own official art she is only briefly visible.

She is a [[petite]] girl with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] and yellow-green eyes. She has very [[small breasts]], possibly [[flat chest]] depending on the artist. She wears a [[shrug]] with a [[fur trim|fur-trimmed]] collar and a black [[microskirt]] over a gray [[leotard]] and [[pantyhose]]. She is currently the sole member of the squad "Heavy Gram".

title: thigh_strap
body:
A strap worn around the [[thighs|thigh]]. A thigh strap may be a band of fabric or leather, or a belt, but not metal.

Not to be confused with a [[thighlet]], which is a band of metal.

Sometimes connect to a [[single garter strap]].

title: handgun
body:
A short-barrelled [[gun|firearm]] designed to be used with one hand or [[two-handed|two hands]] and for shooting at short-ranged targets, while be more concealable to be [[holstered]] than a [[rifle]] or a [[submachine gun]]. Its [[ammunition]] feeding mechanism may vary by design, such as muzzle-loading earlier handguns, [[break action]], by using [[clip (weapon)|clips]] or more commonly [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]].

Handgun types include modern semi-automatic pistols, [[revolver]]s, [[antique firearm]]s such as [[flintlock]]s and [[derringer]]s. This tag also covers the "machine pistol", a handgun capable of fully automatic fire (e.g. [[Beretta 93R]]).

The term "pistol" refers to handguns with a single, stationary (non-revolving) chamber.

For the hand gesture imitating a gun, use [[finger gun]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #6736099: Semi-automatic handgun
* !post #6229047: [[Revolver]]

h4. See also

* [[dual wielding]]
* [[flare gun]]
* [[locked slide]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: narumi_sokichi
body:
The hard-boiled detective mentor of [[Hidari Shoutarou]] and father of [[Narumi Akiko]] from [[Kamen Rider W]].

He was the founder of the Narumi Detective Agency and bearer of the Lost Driver and [[Kamen Rider Skull|Skull]] Memory. Though he was killed before the series begins, he remains a strong influence for Shoutarou and Philip.

title: puckered_anus
body:
When the [[anus]] is tightly pulled together and pushed out in a way that exposes distinct wrinkles or folds or "puckers".

Informally known as a "doughnut" anus.

h4. Examples

* !post #4857342
* !post #5823045

h4. Incorrect Examples

* !post #3845536: no distinct pucker wrinkles/folds/lines
* !post #1990733: don't use on posts that are clearly just the stylized/unrealistic [[x anus]]

title: mecha_hisui
body:
Mecha Hisui is a character from [[Melty Blood]], a spinoff of [[Tsukihime]].

Mecha Hisui is a robotic clone of [[Hisui (tsukihime)|]], created by [[Kohaku (tsukihime)|]] under the influence of the TATARI phenomenon. All mass-produced Mecha Hisui are designed to show complete subordination towards "Doctor" Kohaku.

As a robot, Mecha Hisui is designed with stereotypical anime robot qualities, including [[eye_beam|eye beams]], weapons hidden in her hands, being equipped with a [[jetpack]], and having attacks which reference famous robots from classic anime, such as [[god_gundam|God Gumdam]]'s [[shining_finger|Bakunetsu God Finger]]. 

A second Mecha Hisui, who is shown to be in the possession of [[Neco-arc]], was introduced in [i]Melty Blood: Actress Again[/i]. This Mecha Hisui has assumed control of it's personality, which results in showing highly rude interactions towards Neko-Arc.

She is voiced by [[Matsuki Miyu]].

h4. Official Art

* !post #646676 

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Mech-Hisui":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Mech-Hisui]

title: metrocop
body:
Police of the Combine Overwatch in Earth's cities in the game [[Half-Life 2]]. Some carry [[stun baton]]s, [[h&k usp match|usp match]]s, [[h&k mp7|mp7]]s, and deployable [[manhack]]s. All metrocops wear white gas masks, grey body armor, green pants, and boots. They administer obedience through force and cruelty.

h4. See also
* [[Combine Soldier]]

h4. External links
* Combine Overwiki: "Civil Protection":[https://combineoverwiki.net/wiki/Civil_Protection]

title: julian_alfred_pankratz
body:
Mostly known by his poetic name Dandelion, Julian Alfred Pankratz, Viscount de Lettenhove, is a friend of [[Geralt of Rivia]] in [[the witcher (series)|the Witcher saga]]. A poet who has earned worldwide recognition, a skirt-chaser and a romantic.

In [[the Witcher 3]] game he narrates the events happening (or the events that already have happened) during the loading scenes.

Recognizable by his [[brown hair]], colorful and elegant purple attire and his [[lyre]].

An interesting thing about him is the fact that his name differs from one language to another (that is his nickname, not his real name):

English: Dandelion
Finnish: Valvati
Spansh, Polish, French, Portuguese, Romanian: Jaskier (Buttercup)
Russian: Лютик (Buttercup)
Etc.

title: helena_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Helena[/i] (CL-50). Character design by [[Acea4]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and yellowish [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] which includes a [[neck ribbon]] in the design of the [[American flag]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] [[pin]], a [[black skirt]] with slits, a [[breastplate]]/[[corset]], [[grey thighhighs]] with [[striped thighhighs|stripes]] on the back, and [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] includes her 15 6-inch/47-caliber Mark 16 guns, six on each of her sides and three on top of her weapon, a modified [[Browning Auto 5]] [[shotgun]]. In her [[Helena Kai (kancolle)|Kai]] form her rigging is darker gray, her neck ribbon is changed to a mostly yellow one, her breastplate is removed, and the non-white stripes on her thighhighs are given more assorted colors.

title: fubuki_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Fubuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a small [[ponytail]] and [[sidelocks]] in front, [[black eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit, the Special-Type uniform, is a [[serafuku]] comprising a [[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast carried as a form of backpack, while carrying two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap|thigh straps]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount Type A as a [[handgun]]. She has an earnest and diligent personality, but lacks any notable quirks or notable personality traits, and is often considered very plain. She is the viewpoint character of the official 4koma [i]Fubuki-chan Gambarimasu![/i], as well as the leading role in the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]] adaptation. h4. title: chikuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Chikuma[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[green dress]], [[black belt]], [[single elbow glove|single]] [[brown gloves|brown]] [[elbow gloves|elbow glove]] on her left arm with an [[aircraft catapult]], [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her left leg, and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of all four of her historical 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her right side (three on her thigh, one on her right shoulder), 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left thigh, [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her boots, and a seaplane cradle on her thighhigh.

Personality-wise, she is very, very obsessed with [[Tone (Kancolle)|]], mentioning her in nearly all of her lines and addressing her as nee-san.

title: angelina_(arknights)
body:
[i]Angelina, Supporter Operator and Messenger of Rhodes Island, would like to provide help with her amazing Originium Arts.[/i]

A playable Supporter Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Angelina Ajimu

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Siracusa[/td][/tr]

      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A transporter responsible for delivering intelligence and special cargo around Siracusa. As an apprentice caster Operator, she now provides logistical support, battlefield assistance, and tactical coordination for Rhodes Island. Likes jewelry, young adult novels, and secretly listening to old music.

Capable of manipulating weight and uses an arcane staff to channel her abilities. Due to her Vulpo characteristics, her motif is based on foxes.

She is voiced by [[Oohashi Ayaka]].

title: honolulu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Honolulu[/i] (CL-48). Character design by [[Ugume]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied in [[twin drills]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[large breasts]]. She wears a stylized [[military uniform]] composed of a [[crop top]] which exposes the underside of her breasts, a [[sleeveless dress|sleevess]] [[blue_dress|blue]] [[pleated dress]] and a white [[overskirt]] as well as [[black thighhighs]] and [[rudder_footwear|rudder boots]].  Her [[rigging]] consists of her twin [[smokestack]]s at her back and [[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s at her sides.

Her voice lines give her the impression of being a non-native Hawaii resident who greets and blurts out phrases in the "Hawaiian language":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawaiian_language] and has immersed herself somewhat in the culture of the Hawaiian archipelago.

The historical USS [i]Honolulu[/i] served in the attack on Pearl Harbor, Battle of Tassafaronga, the Battle of Kula Gulf, the Battle of Kolombangara and the Battle of Peleliu. She was taken out of action by serious torpedo damage just before the Battle of Leyte Gulf. She was repaired, but not in time to rejoin the war. She was decommissioned in 1947 and was held in reserve until she was scrapped in 1959, by which time, her namesake city had become the capital of the 50th state to join the Union.

title: ikazuchi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ikazuchi[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with a [[hairclip]]s on her left, [[brown eyes]], and a [[fang]]. Her default outfit is the Special-Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]]), but with the addition of a "III" pin unique to the [i]Akatsuki[/i]-class. The "III" is on the right side of her collar.

An excitable girl, she is often shown with her sister ship [[Inazuma (kancolle)|]]. The two are extremely similar in appearance; having been laid down on the same day they are depicted as [[twins]]. She is also often depicted as very doting to the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]], many a times spoiling them beyond help (her Pixiv nicknames "Loli-Okan" and "Useless Admiral Maker" refer to this side of her). Sometimes depicted as being clingy, to the point of being [[yandere]], leading to the nickname "Black Thunder" among the fandom.

title: inazuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Inazuma[/i], one of the five starter ships. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|Yadokari]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[folded ponytail]]. The [i]Akatsuki[/i]-class wears a [[white shirt]] and dark [[blue sailor collar]], and [[black skirt]], with a "III" pin (symbolizing their stature as the third group of the Special Types) somewhere on themselves, and [[black socks]]. In her case, the "III" is on the lower right side of her shirt. 

A shy and innocent girl, she is also one of "the 5 starter ships":[/pools/9823] and is well known for her catchphrase "[[Nanodesu_(phrase)|]]!".

She also has a [[dark persona]] sometimes called [[Plasma-Chan_(Kancolle)|]]. This is a joke that originated in a comic (post #1917287) where an artist put his words of hatred for another artist named [[Nasu (tenpurakkusu)|]] (whose name means "[[eggplant]]"). Depending on the artist, Inazuma might slip back and forth into Plasma-chan in various ways, from being an irrational response to eggplants, to being "Inazuma's serious side", to simply being an always-psychotic character among some artists with darker proclivities.

title: mogami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Mogami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]], [[grey eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sister [i]Mikuma[/i]: a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[red shirt|red]] [[sailor shirt]] with a dark [[red sailor collar]], [[brown shorts]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and black [[lace-up boots]].  

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, four (or three at kai) 20.3 cm twin gun mounts, and a [[flight deck]] at kai form. She gains two [[radar]] sets at kai form as well. 

She is a frank, upbeat, energetic, and [[tomboy]]ish girl. Due to having collided three times in her historic service, she's commonly portrayed as quite clumsy, and too eager to watch where she's going. Collisions with her sister-ship [[Mikuma (Kancolle)|]] are most commonly portrayed. Because of her boyish looks, she is often portrayed as the target of rumors of being a boy, or outright portrayed as one.

title: mikura_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Mikura[/i]. Character design by [[Acea4]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] done in [[low twintails]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[blue sailor collar]], knotwork tie, white [[undershirt]], [[red_skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[hip vent]]s, [[white hat|white]] [[sailor hat]], [[white gloves]], [[white socks]], and a dolphin pin on her collar, referring to her namesake island's dolphins (she thus joins Taigei's club of wearing cetacean-shaped pins). 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her real-life funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, [[depth charge]]s on her [[brown belt]] and [[thigh strap]], and [[paravane]]s on her ankles.

She is often nicknamed "Okra" due to alternate kanji readings (The "Mi" in "Mikura" can also be read as "O"), even by her artist.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3613038: Base

title: jacqueline_(eversoul)
body:
An Undead-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Lee Bo-hee (Korean) | Moriya Kyouka (Japanese)
[hr]
An artificial Soul, much like [[Mephistopheles (Eversoul)|]], discovered by the [[Savior (Eversoul)|]] and his party while exploring the Forgotten Ruins. She was tasked by Dr. Faust to guard whatever secrets she's hidden within these ruins, [spoilers]which also doubles as a resting place for her former master Cu Chulainn[/spoilers]. After [spoilers][[Linzy (Eversoul)|]]'s "death"[/spoilers], she became a ward of Tabria under the noblewoman [[Rebecca (Eversoul)|]] and is working on acclimating to modern society.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Gáe Bulg":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%A1e_Bulg[/i].

title: genderswap_(otf)
body:
Subset of [[genderswap]] where a character who is normally [[1other|sexless]], [[androgynous]], or [[ambiguous gender|ambiguous]] is instead depicted as female. This is usually indicated by the presence of [[breasts]] and/or [[pussy]].

Simply wearing a feminine outfit is not enough to qualify for this tag, unless the lower portion is tight enough to unambiguously show the absence of a [[bulge]].

Often used on characters from media like [[Houseki no Kuni]] and [[Len'en]], as well as individual characters like the [[Pyro (tf2)|]], [[Frisk (undertale)|]] and [[Chara (undertale)|]].

In [[Zero Escape: Toki no Jirenma|Toki no Jirenma]], she wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[high-waist shorts]], [[black boots|black]] [[combat boots]], and [[blue-framed eyewear|blue-framed]] [[glasses]]. title: na_nare_hana_nare
body:
An original Japanese anime television series produced by [[DMM|DMM.com]] and animated by [[P.A. Works]], set in Takasaki, Maebashi and Numata, Gunma. The series is written and directed by Kōdai Kakimoto, features original character designs by [[Takada Tomomi]] which were adapted into anime designs by [[Sekiguchi Kanami]], and features a script by Kakimoto, Yuniko Ayana, and Midori Gotō.

It aired from July 7 to September 3, 2024.

h4. Characters

title: thigh_scrunchie
body:
A fabric-covered elastic [[scrunchie]] worn around the thigh, commonly seen on [[Pinky pop Hepburn]]. Don't confuse this tag with [[frilled thigh strap]], which is made of a different material and has [[frills]].

h4. See also

title: usada_pekora_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]].

It consists of a [[white coat|white]] [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[coat dress]] worn [[leotard under clothes|over]] a [[strapless leotard|strapless]] [[black leotard|black]] [[playboy bunny|bunnysuit]] with a [[underboob cutout]] or [[cutout above navel]]. A [[white scarf|white]] [[fur scarf]] (which is actually a living [[rabbit]] [[creature]] called [[Don-chan (usada pekora)|]]), [[white sleeves|white]] [[puffy detached sleeves|puffy detached]] [[puffy short sleeves|short sleeves]],  [[black gloves|black]] [[fur-trimmed gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], a [[frilled thigh strap]], fur [[ankle garter]]s and [[white shoes|white]] [[mary janes]] with blue [[colored shoe soles|colored soles]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3574306: Profile
* !post #4030401: Reference sheet
* !post #8202245: Merchandise
* !post #5513469: L2D
