title: gumi
body:
GUMI is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

Licensed as Megpoid (メグッポイド), she is voiced by seiyuu [[Nakajima Megumi]]. Her appearances were initially illustrated by [[Yuuki Masami]], and later by [[nou (nounknown)]]. She wears a two piece outfit consisting of a [[crop top]] and [[frilled skirt]]. Her accessories are white [[wrist cuffs]], [[choker]], and [[boots]]. Around her leg is a red [[frilled thigh strap]], and she wears a gray [[headset]] that has red [[goggles]] attached.

Her orange and green design resulted in her character item being a [[carrot]].

She has received updated voicebanks for VOCALOID3, VOCALOID4, VOCALOID6, [[A.I. VOICE]], and [[Synthesizer V]].

h4. Official art

* !post #3929555: VOCALOID2
* !post #1003851: [[Gumi (V3 Megpoid)|V3 Megpoid]]
* !post #5708698: [[Gumi (A.I. Voice)|A.I. Voice]]
* !post #5745914: [[Gumi (AI Megpoid)|AI Megpoid]] (VOCALOID6)

h4. See also

* [[Gumi (V3 Megpoid)]]

title: love_u_my_friends
body:
Love U my friends is the title track and tenth song on [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club|Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]'s 2nd album.

The costume for the song consists of a [[frilled shirt|frilled]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] with a [[criss-cross halter]], [[frilled straps]], [[rainbow order|rainbow]] stripes and [[flower]]s around the neckline, a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[miniskirt]], a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[rainbow skirt|rainbow-colored]] [[overskirt]] with [[flower]]s around the waist, [[frilled thigh strap]]s, [[white legwear]] [[thighhighs]], [[white gloves]] ad [[wristband]]s and a [[hair ornament]] consisting of a [[hair bow]] and [[hair flower|flowers]].

In typical Love Live! fashion the costume is color coded for each member, with the main skirt, garters, halter and hair ornament matching each idol's associated  color.
other_names: ラブ・ユー・マイ・フレンズ

title: yuki_miku_(2017)
body:
"Twinkle Snow ver."

The 2017 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme for the 2017 design contest was "Stars/constellations of winter Hokkaido", with the winning design by [[Nishina hima]].

Her fan nickname is "Twinkle-chan".

She has blue hair bows with [[stars|star hair ornaments]], a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[blue dress]] decorated with [[constellation print]], blue [[detached sleeves]], and mostly bare legs with a [[frilled thigh strap]]. She wields a [[conductor baton|music baton]] that acts as a magical [[wand]].

Her theme song is [[Star_Night_Snow_(Vocaloid)|Star Night Show]] by Orangestar and nbuna.

title: garter_straps
body:
Straps that connect a garter belt to [[thighhighs]] to keep the thighhighs from falling down. This tag is used when only the garter straps are visible, not the entire garter belt. Sometimes also used to attached to [[thigh strap]]s.

Do not use [[garter belt]] with this tag. If only the straps are visible, use [[garter straps]]. If both the straps and the belt are visible, use [[garter belt]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22701170

h4. See also

* [[garter belt]]
* [[legwear garter]]
* [[shirt stay]]
* [[frilled thigh strap]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
other_names: ガーターストッキング

title: mint_fantome_(minto_2.0)
body:
The current default costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Mint Fantome]], replacing her [[Mint Fantome (minto 1.0)|old design]] from March 2021 onwards. It was originally illustrated by [[kgr]], with the design finalized by [[Ichika Maia (artist)|]]. On Halloween 2024, she debuted an update, illustrated by [[Ayamy]], which she refers to as her 3.0 model.

It's a [[maid]] outfit consisting of a [[triangular headpiece]], a [[maid headdress]], a [[green dress|green]]/[[aqua dress|aqua]] [[vertical-striped dress|vertical-stripped]] [[backless dress|backless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[center frills]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]] [[skirt under dress|under it]], [[aqua sleeves|aqua]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[black bow]], [[uneven legwear]] (a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white]] [[frilled thighhighs|frilled thighhigh]] with a [[black garter straps|black garter strap]] and a [[white socks|white]] [[bobby socks|bobby sock]]) and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]].

Some of the differences between the 2.0 and the 3.0 version are that she wears a [[leotard under clothes|leotard]] under her dress in the 2.0 version, while she wears normal underwear on the 3.0 version, the length of her sleeves is also different, which go [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]] on her 2.0 model but only [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]] on the 3.0 version, also the bridal [[frilled thigh strap]] from her 2.0 version is replaced with a blue [[thigh strap]] with a [[heart-shaped buckle]], and she also has [[pointy ears]] on 3.0.

She has an [[alternate color]] version called Lilac where magenta-purple replaces the white-green.

h4. Appearance

body:

The costume is a [[frills|frilled]] [[white shirt]] that shows the [[navel]] with a [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[suspender skirt]] with a [[black bow]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], and [[red gloves|red]] [[fingerless gloves]].

There are three versions of the costume among the members:

* [[kosaka honoka|Honoka]], [[nishikino maki|Maki]], and [[yazawa nico|Nico]]: color-themed [[bow]], [[black thighhighs]], [[puffy short sleeves]]
* [[ayase eli|Eli]], [[sonoda umi|Umi]], and [[hoshizora rin|Rin]]: color-themed [[striped necktie]], [[short sleeves]], red [[frilled thigh strap]], [[puffy shorts]] instead of a skirt and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] instead of thighhighs.
* [[minami kotori|Kotori]], [[koizumi hanayo|Hanayo]], and [[tojo nozomi|Nozomi]]: color-themed [[neck ribbon]], black [[belt]], [[sleeveless shirt]], [[black thighhighs]], red and black [[frilled thigh strap]]

title: binbou_miko_(kakikorori)
body:
Formerly known as [[Hakurei Reimu]], she used to be the shrine maiden of the Hakurei shrine and main character of the [[Touhou]] series, but now she's [[corruption|corrupted]] into a monster and powerful goddess. Thinking "I want to get out of [[poverty]]. I want money" while being [[transformation|transformed]], twists her motivations into valuing poverty over everything:

[quote]"Being poor is good and makes people happy, thus all people should be poor".[/quote]

The busy miko found one day a strange man, who offered her to end her financial problems. He tricks her and corrupts the miko into what she became now, the head of the Sect of Binbou. She has the ability to go around [[mind control|brainwashing]] people into joining her sect, turning them into dirty poor unglorious versions of their former selves.

She has [[white lips]], [[white eyes|eyes]], and [[colored eyelashes|eyelashes]]; [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], a [[red mask]] in the shape of a [[torii]] and a [[donation box (costume)|donation box]] at the same time (which also works as her hat), and [[colored skin|purple-]][[dark skin|brownish skin]]. What is left from her original [[nontraditional miko|miko outfit]] is a [[red skirt|red]] [[microskirt]] and her [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]] in a [[grey sleeves|grey]] and [[patch|patched]] form. She now wears [[geta]], [[white legwear|white]] [[thighhighs|highlegs]], red [[frilled thigh strap]]s, a [[brown sash|brown]] [[wood]] [[obi]] with two [[coin on string|coins]] knotted over it and a [[bra]] made of [[holed coin|golden cash coins]]. A [[shimenawa]] hangs from her hips, with a large [[medallion]] and [[shide]] hanging from it, the former with the word "POVERTY" carved in it. She has what used to be her [[gohei]], transformed into the Binbou Stick with the word "[s]GOLD[/s]" in its top. 

[quote]"Ufufu ... My name is Binbou Miko. I came here to spread Binbou."[/quote]

Created by [[kakikorori]].

title: hina_misora
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber]] under [[WACTOR production]]'s second generation. She's a charismatic and energetic apprentice [[idol]] who fell from the sky and lost her memory, but was rescued by a [[whale]] named [[Kujira-chan (hina misora)|]]. Her first language is Japanese, but she also has an advanced level of Spanish. However, with the way she expresses, she is often misinterpreted (out of context) by her fans due to the double entendre in Spanish.

Her fan marks are a whale and a star (🐳✨) and her fanbase on youtube are called "[[Misopita (hina misora)|]]s," the plural diminutive for her nickname "Misopa", which is a portmanteau of Misora's name and the word "sopa" (Spanish for "soup"). On Bilibili they are also called 「弱PC団」 (weak PC team) due to problems with her desktop PC and internet connection.

Hina Misora's contract was terminated on the 9th of February, 2023, with [[Meica (vtuber)|her soul]] confirming such on the 15th, along with her former genmates releasing statements on WACTOR, prompting retaliatory action from their former employer. 

h4. Appearance

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]] and [[pink eyes|pink]] [[gradient eyes]] with [[cross-shaped pupils]], [[blue nails]], and [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[long hair]] which is mainly [[black hair|black]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and a couple [[streaked hair|hair streaks]]. Originally her hair was arranged in a [[two side up]] tied with blue [[hair ribbon]]s and one [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower]]. Her second outfit had [[low twintails]] and her third outfit had a [[double bun]].

h4. Outfits

Her original oufit (post #4780219) consists of a [[blue dress|blue]], [[plaid dress]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s, [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[white bow]]; a [[white collar]] with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[neck ribbon]] and a [[pink bowtie]]; and a [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]], [[black pantyhose]] with [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[pink pantyhose|pink]] on one side. She also wears [[wrist cuffs]], [[blue headwear]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[high heels]].

Her second outfit (post #5404384) consists of a [[wa maid]]-style [[blue kimono|blue]], [[plaid kimono]] with [[wide sleeves]]; a [[multicolored skirt|multicolored]] [[blue skirt|blue]] and [[pink skirt|pink]] [[kimono skirt]] with [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical stripes]] on one side; a [[maid apron]]; and black [[thighhighs]]. She also wears a [[frilled thigh strap]], a [[legwear garter]] with a [[heart o-ring]], a frilled cap and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots]].

Her third outfit (post #6071436) consists of a [[white shirt]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] neck ribbon and [[center frills]], [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[suspender shorts]] [[high-waist shorts]], a [[red cardigan|red]] [[beret]], a [[thigh belt]] around one leg, [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[ankle boots]].

h4. External links
* "Youtube":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6tSB9TnO0f01OBeo9UEJZA
* "Bilibili":https://space.bilibili.com/1644927644
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/Hina_Misora
* "Virtual YouTuber Wiki: Hina Misora":https://virtualyoutuber.fandom.com/wiki/Hina_Misora

title: rurine_luna
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[WACTOR Production]]. She's a girl born from the moonlight, thanks to the howling of [[wolf|wolves]] and their love for the [[moon]]. Her fans are called "[[lomito_(rurine_luna)|Lomitos]]", an endearing way to call dogs, which rhymes with the Spanish diminutive for wolves.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[short hair|short]] or [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Her other hairstyles include a red [[hairclip]] or a [[two side up]] or [[twintails]] held up with [[crescent hair ornament|crescent hair ornaments]], and a [[single braid|single]] [[french braid]]. She also has a [[heart facial mark|heart]] or [[star facial mark]]

Her original outfit (post #4825285, post #4926779) consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[crop top]], covered by her characteristic [[fur-trimmed hood|fur-trimmed]] [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[wolf ears]] and [[blue jacket|blue]] [[two-sided jacket|lining]]. It also includes [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] held with a [[white belt]], a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[fold-over boots]].

Her second outfit (post #5299540) consists of [[black shirt|black]] and [[blue shirt|blue]] crop top, a [[multicolored skirt|multicolored]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[layered skirt]] with [[frilled skirt|frills]], a [[black belt]] and a ripped [[back bow]]. Her legwear is [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] with [[paw print|paw prints]] on one leg and a [[frilled thigh strap]] on the other. She sometimes wears a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] version of her hoodie and [[paw gloves]]. Her boots remain the same.

title: yanhe
body:
YANHE is a Chinese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Shanghai HENIAN Co. Ltd, and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. Created for the [[vsinger (vocaloid)|VOCALOID China Project]], she was illustrated by [[mouseqi|MQ]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]], [[aqua eyes]], and [[pale skin]]. She wears a white [[jacket]] over a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless top]], [[black shorts]] with criss-cross [[belt]]s, stylized [[loafers]] and a single [[frilled thigh strap]] with a [[leg ribbon|ribbon]]. Her accessories are [[headphones]] and [[wristband]]s.

Yanhe's voicebank was originally made for [[Zhiyu Moke]] as a shota male vocal. Due to "issues at the time":https://vocaloid.fandom.com/wiki/Controversy_Concerns/Character_issues#YANHE_and_Zhiyu_Moke, Yamaha took back the possession of Moke's character alongside the other Vocaloid China characters in development from HENIAN. As a result, the company urgently held a second character design contest, where the winning entry suggested an [[androgynous]] girl based on how the voicebank sounds, due to it being meant for a boy. This is why Yanhe looks and sounds very androgynous.

body:

She's a [[Magical girl|maho shoujo]] [[rabbit girl]], wearing a [[white dress|white]] [[layered dress]], white [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[purple bowtie]] with a [[rabbit brooch|rabbit-shaped brooch]], and [[mini wings]]. She also wears [[white gloves]] and [[mary janes]]. Her legwear is [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]] with a [[frilled thigh strap]], [[ankle garter]], [[leg ribbon]], [[red footwear|red shoe]]  on one side, and [[bandaid on leg|multiple]] [[bandaid on knee|bandaids]], a [[loose socks|loose sock]] and a [[pink footwear|pink shoe]] on the other.

For her default hairstyle, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[split-color hair|split-color]] [[pink hair|pink]] and [[white hair|white]] hair with some [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[hair rings]] a [[star ahoge]], [[braid|braids]] and [[hair ribbon|ribbons]]

title: xingqiu_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

The second son of the Feiyun Commerce Guild, Xingqiu has had a reputation for being studious and polite ever since he was a young child.
But there is another side to the mild-mannered Xingqiu everyone knows. A daring, adventurous, and much more mischievous side...

His name is pronounced [b]Yukuaki[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Xingqiu has dark, navy [[blue hair]] with [[asymmetrical bangs]] and [[yellow_eyes|golden amber eyes]]. He has a slight frame and a light skin tone. He typically wears a blue [[earrings|earring]] with a gold [[tassel_earrings|tassel]] on his right ear. He is the only character who wears a [[single_earring|single right earring]]. Other characters either have two earrings, no earrings, or a single left earring. His [[vision_(genshin_impact)|vision]] is pinned to the bottom of the left side of his coat on top of a span of frilled, white fabric. A tassel made of amber which matches his eyes hangs from the vision.

His attire consists of a [[long_coat|long coat]] of silk which gradients from black at the collar, to shades of navy blue as the material descends. The coat's underneath is colored a contrasting yellow and a faint, wavy pattern which alludes to his hydro vision is situated all over the fabric. His [[frilled_shirt_collar|collar]] and shoulder plates are rimmed with a gold, metallic material and to the right side of his chest sits a large and circular [[brooch|brooch]]. It's embedded with a blue jewel, alike the center of his collar, coat buttons and sleeve cuffs (front and side). Underneath, Xingqiu wears a white [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[shirt|shirt]] with a frilled seam to the right, revealed by the slit of his coat behind two overlapping ribbon-like buttons. He additionally wields distinct, [[frilled_sleeves|frilled sleeves]] which extend from his coat's baggy, gold pair. A clover-like [[ribbon|ribbon]] of white, black and yellow is pinned to the right side of his [[belt|belt]]. Beneath this hangs a pair of rectangular ribbons, one in white covering a notably longer, black ribbon. Both of them wield gold decals at their ends. He also wears a pair of navy-[[blue_shorts|blue shorts]] with ends of black that are mostly concealed by the length of his coat. On his right leg, Xingqiu wears a [[frilled thigh strap|garter]] with a blue tassel, just below the knee. His footwear consists of a pair of white high-calf [[boots|boots]], black at the [[high_heels|heels]] and soles with gold motifs.

title: saban's_masked_rider
body:
The American adaptation of [[Kamen Rider Black RX (series)|]], which aired from 1995 to 1996. A controversial Americanized adaptation of the series, completely altering the tone of the source material whilst also utilizing footage from the movies [i]Kamen Rider ZO[/i] and [[Kamen Rider J (movie)|]]. The failure of the adaptation, critically and comercially, would kill any further Western adaptation efforts, with the only attempt since being 2008's [[Kamen Rider Dragon Knight]]. [[Kamen Rider Black Sun (series)|]] is joked as having been created as a means of reverge against this show.

Prior to the premiere of the series, there would be a crossover episode with [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]], serving as a quasi-backdoor pilot.

[[Kamen Rider Black RX]] is simply referred to as [[Masked Rider (Saban)|]], [[Roborider]] is Masked Rider Super Gold, and [[Biorider]] is Masked Rider Super Blue - [[Kamen Rider ZO]] and [[Kamen Rider J]] appear as unnamed green forms, but often nicknamed collectively as Masked Rider Super Green. [[Dex Stewart]] serves as protagonist, a prince of the planet Edenoi, where the Masked Rider serves as guardian of the planet (lending the nickname of Edenoirider).

In Japan, the series is most well-known for its handling of Black RX's Ten Veteran Riders. In the roll call footage, two of the Riders were edited out, but the names were kept in chronological order in the script, resulting in a comedic name switch-up (most famously [[Skyrider]] dramatically declaring "I AM [[kamen rider amazon|AMAZON]]!").
other_names: サバン・マスクド・ライダー
サバンのマスクド・ライダー
サバンの仮面ライダー

title: rhino_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Chiappa Rhino]] [[handgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A small and nimble Doll adept in concealment and infiltration, and always makes surprising discoveries in unexpected places. Having been through a lot of training and accumulated plenty of combat experience, she is very confident in her own abilities. Serious and down-to-earth, she follows every single order to the tee, but also often gets her leg pulled by others. She falls for all kinds of fibs, so she starts having doubts even when people are actually telling the truth. The reason why she's always wearing a cape that clearly doesn't fit her seems to be a subject that one should steer well clear of.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5085929

h4. Skins

* !post #5370338: [[Rhino (Lunar Crown) (girls' frontline)|Lunar Crown]]
* [[Rhino (Castling Rook) (girls' frontline)|Vaulting Knight]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Girls' Frontline characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Rhino":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Rhino]

title: disney
body:

title: mika_blazedaric
body:
[[Mika Blazedaric]] is a female character from [[Ange Vierge]].
She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] with [[orange hair|orange]] [[colored tips|tips]].

(The rendering of her surname [i]bureizudariku[/i] (jap. ブレイズダリク), as [i]Blazedaric[/i], is a best guess.)

title: marcie_fleach
body: [[Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated]] character, otherwise known as Hot Dog Water. A rival-turned-friend of [[Velma Dinkley|Velma]]'s, her relationship with her would be romantically-coded, with it confirmed that the two would become a couple after the series' ending.

title: scooby-doo
body:
A long-running supernatural/comedy cartoon series from [[Hanna-Barbera]]/[[Cartoon Network]], originally airing in the 1970s. In Japan, it was briefly known as 'Yowamushi Kuruppaa' (Cowardly Crooper/Krupper) before switching to the international name.

title: testicles
body:
The primary male sexual organs. They are responsible for the production of sperm, which are transported via [[cum|semen]] to the [[uterus]] of a female, at which point they are used to [[pregnant|impregnate]] her. The testicles are also a major male erogenous zone.

Technically, when testicles are tagged, it is actually the scrotum surrounding the testicles which is visible in most cases. A true view of the testicles would require a cross-section.

title: everyone
body:
An image containing everyone (or a significant portion) of the cast in a show or game.

If the post contains characters you don't recognize, use [[everyone]] + [[character request]].

Contrast with [[absolutely everyone]], which is for massive [[crossover]]s or series with an absurd number of characters (at least 50 is a good rule of thumb).

h4. See also
* [[annotation request]]
* [[character counter request]]
* [[lineup]] - a common technique used when presenting many characters
* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]

title: naka_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Naka[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] in a [[double bun]] with [[antenna hair]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: an [[orange shirt]] with [[white sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[black shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnels on her ankles, 14 cm gun mounts on both of her elbow gloves (with an additional [[aircraft catapult]] on her right), and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] attached to her [[black belt]]. 

Considers herself as being the fleet's [[idol]]. She is a common unwanted drop, leading to the nickname "[[2 Fuel 4 ammo 11 steel|2 Fuel, 4 Ammo, 11 Steel Girl]]" after the amount of resources you get from dismantling her, often representing her as an actual pile of these resources. 

Historically, [i]Naka[/i] was to be the second of the Sendai-class and was actually laid down before [[Jintsuu (Kancolle)|]]. However, the Great Kanto Earthquake of 1923 damaged Naka's original hull so much that she need to be scrapped and be rebuilt from scratch. She was finally completed in 1925, making her the third and last of her class. 

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Light Cruiser Oni]] first form.

title: yukikaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yukikaze[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[long shirt|long]] [[sailor shirt]] (or [[white dress|white]] [[short dress|short]] [[sailor dress]]) with a [[yellow neckerchief]] and [[blue sailor collar]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]], Type 22 [[radar]] horns on the sides of her hair, a [[speaking tube headset]], 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back, 12.7 cm [[handgun]] mount, and [[binoculars]]. 

She is often compared to some sort of rodent (usually a [[Yukikaze (Hamster)|hamster]] or a [[yukikaze_(beaver)|beaver]]) due to the prominent upper teeth seen in her official art.

The historical [i]Yukikaze[/i] was transferred to the [[Taiwan|Republic of China]] as ROCS [[Tan Yang (Kancolle)|]] in 1947 as a war prize, where she served as the flagship of their navy. She was scrapped in 1970.

title: kako_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Kako[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]], [[messy_hair|messy]] [[black hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[ahoge]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[serafuku]] style composed of a [[white shirt]] [[midriff]] with [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is mechanical in theme and consists of her funnel and foremast on her back, two 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her right arm, a third 20.3 cm twin mount on her left shoulder, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She is a [[tomboy]] and uses language that is "rough around the edges". She also has something of a lazy or carefree/careless streak. She seems highly attached to her "older sister" [[Furutaka (Kancolle)|]].

title: hamakaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hamakaze[/i]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[hair over one eye|her bangs covering her right eye]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is the uniform exclusive to her and the 17th Destroyer Division: a [[white shirt]] top with blue trim and [[blue sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[white gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single hull piece to her back containing both her funnels, foremast, and a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a second 12.7 cm twin mount and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] as [[handgun]]s. 

Due to similarities in appearance, she is frequently compared to characters from other franchises, including [[Mash Kyrielight]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]], [[Rem (re:zero)|]] from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]] and occasionally [[Konpaku Youmu]] from [[Touhou]] and [[2B (Nier:Automata)|]] from [[Nier:Automata]].

title: mamiya_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese supply ship [i]Mamiya[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[hairclip]] and red [[hair ribbon]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[collared shirt]], long [[blue skirt]], [[white apron|white]] [[kappougi]], [[white socks]], and [[grey sandals|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is a hull piece to her back containing her funnel, foremast, bridge, and crane.

A non-combatant, she is only available as an item card with the ability to remove all fatigue in your fleet, explaining her [[motherly]] personality and depictions in fanart.

Notable in real life to be the [i]real[/i] idol of the Imperial Japanese Navy at the time, due to the ship's massive food and sweets production boosting the morale of many naval personnel. The US Navy at the time deemed her and [i][[akashi (kancolle)|Akashi]][/i] to be high priority targets, and as such she was frequently escorted by destroyers during the war.

title: cool_mita_(miside)
body:
Cool Mita, also known as Cappie, is one of the many [[Mita_(miside)|]]s in [[MiSide]].

Like most other Mitas, Cool Mita is a young woman of average height with [[medium breasts]], [[dark blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]].

Her clothing closely matches default Mitas - she wears [[red thighhighs]], a [[blue_skirt|blue]], [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] skirt, a [[red sweater]] and a [[red choker]].

Her unique characteristics that distinguish her from other Mitas include her [[teardrop tattoo]] below her left eye, her [[ponytail]] hair style, her [[blue gloves]], and most importantly - her [[blue_hat|blue]] [[animal_ear_headwear|cat-eared]] [[cabbie hat]].

Sometimes depicted with a [[hitachi magic wand]], due to an in-game scene where she accidentally shows it to the player.

title: hirako_shinji
body:
[[Bleach]] character.

[b]Shinji Hirako[/b] is the leader of the Visored, a group of exiled Shinigami who possess Hollow powers. He is also the former Captain of the Gotei 13's 5th Division.

Laid-back and calm, often with a large grin on his face, he is nonetheless flustered in the face of [[Sarugaki Hiyori|Hiyori Sarugaki]]'s insults.

17 months after the defeat of [[Aizen Sousuke|Aizen]], Shinji is reinstated to his former position as Captain of the 5th Division, in place of Aizen himself.

* [[Sakashima Yokoshima Happoufusagari]]

title: sagisawa_fumika
body:
[i][[idolmaster cinderella girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. A college student who works part time at her uncle's bookstore, Fumika is a girl who loves books and often gets lost in them. She is shy and dislikes talking to people. She appears in THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA MASTER Cool jewelries! 002. Due to her popularity, she was selected for the seventh CINDERELLA MASTER CD series, alongside [[Himekawa Yuki]], [[Ichihara Nina]], [[Miyamoto Frederica]], and [[Hayami Kanade]]. title: shirakami_fubuki
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[1st generation (hololive)|]]. Also a member of [[hololive Gamers]]. Designed by [[Nagishiro Mito]]. On November 5th, 2020, Fubuki became the third member of hololive (after [[Gawr Gura]] and [[Inugami Korone]]) to reach 1 million subscribers on YouTube.

She is a white and black [[fox girl]] with [[fox ears]] with [[animal ear piercing|ear piercing]] on her left ear and a white and black-tipped [[fox tail]] with a [[pentagram]] inscription near the tip. She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair|grey]] hair with an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]. Her regular hairstyle consists of a [[low ponytail]] held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]].

title: life-size_gardevoir_plush
body:
A life-size [[character_doll|plush]] of [[Gardevoir]] that the Pokémon Center began "selling":https://www.pokemoncenter.com/product/72-10419-101/gardevoir-poke-plush-63-in on February 6th, 2025. The plush is 5'3 (1.6 meters tall) and immediately gained notoriety for obvious reasons.

A "viral Tweet":https://twitter.com/Rukocos/status/1888776951785197733 of the plush wearing [[black pantyhose]] inspired a "minor trend":[/posts?tags=gardevoir+pantyhose+id%3A%3E8838936+order%3Aid] of drawing Gardevoir in the same garment.

title: raj_koothrappali
body: Rajesh Ramayan "Raj" Koothrappali, Ph.D. is a fictional character and one of the main protagonists on the 2007-2019 CBS television series [[The Big Bang Theory]], portrayed by British-Indian actor Kunal Nayyar. He is one of four main male characters in the show, alongside Sheldon Cooper, Leonard Hofstadter and Howard Wolowitz to appear in every episode of The Big Bang Theory. Raj is based on a computer programmer that the show's co-creator, Bill Prady, knew when he was a programmer.

title: leonard_hofstadter
body: Ostensibly the main character of [[The Big Bang Theory]], Leonard is the most normal of the guys by never having any outlandish quirks and generally operates as the Only Sane Man. He (and his friends) work at Cal Tech, his field being in Experimental Physics. He has lived with Sheldon since late 2002 and is his best friend, though Sheldon's quirks annoy him to no end. He instantly gained a crush on Penny when she moved into the apartment across the hall and much of the show is about how they both change from interacting with each other.

title: gamera
body:
The titular [[turtle]] [[kaiju|kaiju]] from the [[Gamera (series)|]] series.

In most of his iterations, Gamera is an ancient, prehistoric creature that was either genetically modified or mutated. Thanks to the volatile substances stored within his body, he has the powers of fire breath and jet-propelled flight. In some depictions, he also has telepathy and is capable of sensing human emotions. He most often acts as a guardian, protecting humanity against other monsters.

title: vendrick_(dark_souls)
body: [i][[Dark Souls II]][/i] character. The founder and former king of Drangleic [spoilers]prior to his hollowing[/spoilers]. He can be fought as an optional boss in the Undead Crypt, and his memory serves as an NPC for [i]The Lost Crowns[/i] expansions.

title: techno_police_21c
body:
[b][i]Techno Police 21C[/i][/b] (テクノポリス21C [i]Tekunoporisu Nijūisseki[/i]) is a 1982 [[Japan]]ese [[science fiction]] [[cyberpunk]], [[mecha]] and [[police]] action anime film made by [[toho_(film_company)|Toho Productions]] and produced by [[JVC]]. It was released in August 7, 1982.

Techno Police started in 1978 as an idea for a TV series from Artmic Studio founder Suzuki Toshimichi as a coproduction with Studio Nue. After 4 years in development the series was scrapped and the existing footage was compiled into an 80 minute movie and distributed by Toho.

Hisaishi Joe, who provides the synth-jazz score and is well known in the west for having created the soundtracks of several anime and live action films. Part of the animation and design staff were also [[Kawamori Shouji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] from Studio Nue, who are now famous for their mecha designs from [[MACROSS]]. Their work in Techno Police actually served them as preparation during the pre-production design phase of the first Macross series.

English dubbed versions of the film were released in VHS format during 1984 and 1987. Outside of the English speaking world unedited video versions of Techno Police 21C were seen in France, Germany and Spain, with even a theatrical run in Cuba.

In 1994/5 Techno Police was re-released by Best Film & Video Co on NTSC VHS to cash in on the popular rise in anime and Cyberpunk at the time with OVA's such as [[Bubblegum Crisis]], [[Appleseed]], [[Dangaiou]], [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor|Patlabor]], [[A.D. Police Files|AD Police]], [[Armitage III]] and Cyber City Oedo 808.

h4. See also

* [[Technoid]]s
* [[Scanny]]
* [[Blader]]
* [[Tom (Techno Police)]]
* [[Fubuki Eren]]

title: a.d._police_files
body:
A 3-episode [[science fiction]] OVA released in 1990. 

The [b]A.D. Police Files[/b] series is a [[cyberpunk]] prequel to the original [[Bubblegum Crisis]] [[mecha]] series from the 80s.

The OVA was produced by Youmex and animated by Artmic and AIC. Its first episode was released in May 25, 1990, while the last one was released in November 22, 1990. Each episode was 26 minutes long. 

A.D. Police Files was originally intended to be a more complete and longer mini-series, but due to a legal conflict between Artmic and Youmex, the production of the series was stopped with only three complete episodes made, thus they were released as an OVA instead.

h4. See also

* [[Caroline Evers]]
* [[Billy Fanward]]

title: future_cop:_lapd
body:
[b]Future Cop: LAPD[/b] is a 1998 third-person [[science fiction]] and [[cyberpunk]] [[3D]] shooter [[video game]] developed by EA Redwood Shores and published by Electronic Arts and released first for the [[PlayStation 1]] console, then Mac OS and Microsoft Windows. The game was released in Japan in 1999. 

In the game, players assume the role of a [[police]] officer [[pilot]] for the [[X1-Alpha]], a [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] designed to fight in the "Crime War" in Los Angeles, California, USA during the year 2098. 

Despite its poor sales, the game received generally positive reviews.

title: cyberpunk
body:
A [[science fiction]] genre. Basic themes include the dehumanizing effects of technology, and the accompanying societal breakdown. Think dark and dirty, with lots of [[wire]]s and [[neon lights|neon]].

[b]Cyberpunk[/b] is a postmodern dystopian genre noted for its focus on [b]”high tech and low life"[/b]. The name is a portmanteau of cybernetics and punk, and was originally coined by American science fiction author Bruce Bethke as the title of his short Sci-Fi story [i]Cyberpunk[/i], written in 1980.

Cyberpunk can cover numerous themes and motifs but generally involve reflecting on the current anxieties of society and amping them up to an extreme; things like mass surveillance, corporate monopolization, climate change, mass media, artificial intelligence and any other themes can thus be accomodated by a cyberpunk setting.

For the series of the same name, see [[Cyberpunk (series)]].

title: united_nations
body:
The United Nations (abbreviated UN in English, and ONU in French and Spanish), is an international organization whose stated aims are facilitating cooperation in international law, international security, economic development, social progress, human rights, and achievement of world peace. It was founded in 1945 after [[World War II]] to replace the League of Nations, to stop wars between countries, and to provide a platform for dialogue. It contains multiple subsidiary organizations to carry out its missions. There are 193 member states, including every internationally recognised sovereign state in the world but Vatican City.

The United Nations Headquarters reside in international territory in New York City, with further main offices at Geneva, Nairobi, and Vienna. The organization is financed from assessed and voluntary contributions from its member states, and has six official languages: Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian, and Spanish.

The United Nations peacekeepers are required to wear their [[military uniform]]s where they come from, along with a [[blue helmet]] or a [[blue hat|]] [[beret]]. Their [[military vehicle]]s are also painted white.

h4.See also

* [[U.N. Spacy]]

title: cars_(movie)
body:
[[Pixar]]'s seventh film, released in theaters on June 9, 2006. The film is set in an alternate universe where each character is a variety of vehicle, whether [[car]], [[airplane]], or [[watercraft]]. The film focuses on a novice racer named "[[Lightning McQueen]]" who discovers the lost town of Radiator Springs on his way to the most important race of his life.

Would kickstart a series of films, with Cars 2 in 2011, and Cars 3 in 2017, alongside other media.

title: d_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. Member of [[Perilous Siege (nikke)|]] together with [[K (Nikke)|]].

The leader of Perilous Siege. Not a single wicked soul will escape from her grasp, so long she believes their death will be of benefit to the world. Has a tendency to play up her persona when carrying out a mission.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[black coat|black]] [[long coat|long]] [[hooded coat]] with her [[hood up]], wears a [[black shirt]] with [[tactical clothes]] on top, wears [[black gloves]], [[grey shorts|grey]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[short shorts]], with a [[holster]] where she carries a [[gun]], she also wears [[black footwear|black]] and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. Can be seen carrying a [[hatchet (axe)|]] during her missions along with her [[submachine gun]] and a [[bag]] on her back.

Illustrators: [[Dramz|D.ramz]] (default), [[Aronman]] (Killer Wife)

body:

To obtain information on her target, D disguised herself as a young married woman. She plays the role of a kind and gentle wife perfectly. 

She still wields her [[hatchet (axe)|hatchet]] for close quarters, but has swapped her [[submachine gun]] out for a [[sniper rifle]]. D also swapped out her tactical outfit for a [[dongtan dress]] as part of her disguise as newlyweds with the [[Commander (nikke)|player character]] for a story event.

title: saratoga_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy aircraft carrier USS [i]Saratoga[/i] (CV-3). 
Character designed by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

A jarringly young-looking girl with an equally childish and girly personality. She has [[long hair|long]], [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] with an [[ahoge]] while wearing a [[hairband]] with a [[smokestack]]-like accessory. She wears a [[backless outfit|backless-like]], [[sleeveless dress]] with a [[black ribbon]] on it, and an attached cannon. Underneath it was a [[military uniform]] with an [[armband]]. She also wears [[black pantyhose]] and [[elbow gloves]] as well as carrying a [[staff]] with a [[flight deck]]-like banner. She has [[small breasts]] that she's conscious of compared to the much more endowed [[illustrious (azur lane)|Illustrious]] and [[Ranger (azur lane)|Ranger]]. The fact that she has them at all tends to be forgotten by others, including her own artist, [[Saru]] as seen in a number of her skins.

title: saimin_seishidou
body:
[[Saimin Seishidou]] ("Sexual Instruction by Hypnosis"), is an erotic doujin manga by [[Aiue Oka]]. With the power of [[hypnosis]], the male protagonist [[tanaka_hajime_(saimin_seishidou)|Tanaka Hajime]] impersonates himself as a sexual instructor at his school.

The series has also spawned a hentai anime adoption, as well as two visual novels: [[Saimin Gakushuu|Saimin Gakushuu -Secret Desire-]] (2021) and [[Saimin Seishidou -Secret Lesson-]] (2024)

title: tanaka_hajime_(saimin_seishidou)
body:
[[tanaka_hajime_(saimin_seishidou)|Tanaka Hajime]] is the male protagonist of [[Saimin Seishidou]].
He is [[ugly man|ugly]], has a [[crew cut]] and wears [[glasses]].

When a character's eyes light up in [[excited|excitement]], usually with a yellow four-pointed sparkle in the center. [[Sparkle]]s may also appear around their head.

Do not confuse with [[star-shaped pupils]], which is for literal four/five-pointed star shaped eyes, or for characters who have naturally [[cross-shaped pupils]], such as [[Nia Teppelin]] or [[Chinchou]].

* !post #1181626

title: giant_of_light
body:
The species of giants from the [[Ultra Series]], casually referred to as the [i]Ultra[/i] species, due to not having any official name. In lieu of that, they are often referred to as [i]Giants of Light[/i] in official media. They are sometimes also referred to as the [i]Residents of the [[Land of Light]][/i] (or Light-lander), or [i]Residents of the M78 Nebula[/i], but this can be ambiguous as the Ultras are not the only species there, and they can be found residing in other lands/nebulas/universes (ex. the Ultra People of Planet U40).

This tag is intended for depictions of Giants of Light that aren't any of the official Ultra characters, whether it be ersatz characters just referencing the series, or [[original]] Ultra characters.

They are depicted with skin that feature either silver, red or blue as their dominant color, and then either of the remaining two along with black or more as highlights, with their dominant color representing to which subspecies among the Ultra species they belong to. Every Giant's body bears unique markings/patterns and features which enables them to be distinguished from one another (this includes the various generic unique designs made for depicting the Light-landers, though some depictions have generic Ultras depicted as looking basically like [[Ultraman]]).

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Residents of the Land of Light":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Residents_of_the_Land_of_Light]
other_names: オリジナルウルトラマン

title: youtube_creator_award
body:
[b]YouTube Creator Awards[/b] are a series of plaques awarded by [[YouTube]] in recognition of popular channels and content creators. They are based on subscriber count, however not every channel which reaches the required level receives one, as YouTube grants them at its own discretion.

The current awards and their associated subscriber counts are:
* [b][[Silver Creator Award]][/b] - [u]100,000 subscribers[/u]
** - Nickel alloy
* [b][[Gold Creator Award]][/b] - [u]one million subscribers[/u]
** - Gold-plated brass. This is the award most commonly depicted.
* [b]Diamond Creator Award[/b] - [u]ten million subscribers[/u]
** - Silver-plated metal inset with colorless crystal glass in the shape of a play button triangle.
* [b]Custom[/b] (a.k.a. [b]Ruby[/b]) [b]Creator Award[/b] - [u]50 million subscribers[/u]
** - Design varies according to receipient.
** - 35 recipients as of October 2022
* [b]Red Diamond Creator Award[/b] - [u]100 million subscribers[/u]
** - Dark glass or metal with red Baccarat crystal (made of gold, barium oxide, and sand) in the shape of a play button triangle.
** - Only 10 recipients as of March 2024: [[PewDiePie]], "T-Series":https://www.youtube.com/user/tseries, "Cocomelon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cocomelon, "Sony Entertainment Television India":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sony_Entertainment_Television, [[MrBeast]], "Kids Diana Show":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kids_Diana_Show], "Like Nastya":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Like_Nastya], "Vlad and Niki":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vlad_and_Niki], "Zee Music Company":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zee_Music_Company], and [[WWE]].

h4. External links

* "Creator Awards for Subscriber Milestones - YouTube Creators":[https://www.youtube.com/creators/how-things-work/programs-initiatives/awards/]

title: convenient_censoring
body:
Obstructing the view of genitals (or some other sensitive anatomical features) using several devices within a scene, such as unnecessary smoke or views with obstacles immediately in front of the viewer. Note that this tag mostly applies to obstructions that happen to be there against all odds, not cases where characters are deliberately covering themselves with something other than clothes.

[i]Example:[/i] Hair or wings that are draped over a girl's nipples don't necessarily count as convenient censoring, but if she is jumping/rolling/moving, and they just so happen to move in the way of her nipples in the process, that [i]is[/i] convenient censoring.

For artificial obstructions that are [i]external[/i] to the scene, like a [[bar_censor|black bar]] or a [[mosaic_censoring|mosaic]] pattern, use the [[censored]] tag.

h4. See also

* [[convenient leg]]
* [[convenient uncensoring]]
* [[hair censor]]
* [[hair over breasts]]
* [[interface censor]]
* [[soap censor]]
* [[steam censor]]
* [[tail censor]]
* [[wing censor]]

title: copium_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] involving a fictional inhalable substance that allowed the user to "cope" with harsh reality, usually via an [[oxygen mask]].

The word "copium" is a portmanteau of "cope" (to create a psychological defense of a lighter belief to deal with a harsh truth) and [[opium]] (a [[drugs]]).

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme.com":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/copium]

title: era_bricks_(meme)
body:
In early 2023, [[meme]]s were made about the [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] army putting explosive [[reactive armor]] (ERA) on seemingly everything, following deliveries of [[Leopard 2]] tanks from [[Poland]] as a part of NATO aid for the [[Russo-Ukrainian war]].

The memes spread to [[4chan]]'s /pol/, /k/ and [[Reddit]]'s r/NonCredibleDefense sub where ERA bricks were used as an exploitable, being edited onto image macros and meme templates along with Ukrainian soldier-coded Flork of Cows characters.

These ERA memes were also called "Cope Bricks" in reference to [[Copium (meme)|]] and [[Cope Cage]]s.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Explosive Reactive Armor (ERA)":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/explosive-reactive-armor-era]

title: reactive_armor
body:
External modular armor packages used in [[tank]]s and other [[real life]] modern [[military vehicle]]s. Reactive armor actively reduces the damage a vehicle equipped with it receives, instead of passively resisting it like traditional armor.  

The most common type of reactive armor currently is [b]Explosive Reactive Armor[/b] ([b]ERA[/b]), which will detonate when penetrated and impair or deflect the incoming projectile.  This type of armor appears as tiles or plates fitted on top of the normal armor of the vehicle equipped with it. Once their protective surface is spent they can be removed to save weight.

This system is also featured in several [[mecha]] from realistic sci-fi anime and manga.

h4.See also
* [[ERA Bricks (meme)]]
* [[VF-0S Armored]]
* [[VF-1J Armored]]
* [[VF-1S Armored]]
* [[Gundam Alex]]
* [[GM Cannon II]]
* [[Full Armor ZZ Gundam]]

title: sialim_eltnam_re-atlasia
body:
A minor character in [[Fate/EXTRA]].

Sialim Eltnam Re-Atlasia is the last alchemist of the Atlas institute in the world of EXTRA. She has a twin [[sion eltnam atlasia|elder sister]] who died at birth. As an Atlasian alchemist she was devoted only to her own research, her goal is to avoid the future of destruction. Essentially, this means that it's okay for humanity to change or decline as a species if it means surviving. She created the homunculus known as [[Rani VIII]] with the intention to see if it was possible for not just alchemists but for humanity to continue existing in the cyber world, which would mean having to give up their physical bodies. After sending Rani to the moon, she succumbed to a terminal disease and passed away in a month.

h4. See also

* "Type-Moon wikia entry":http://typemoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sialim_Eltnam_Re-Atlasia#Sialim_Eltnam_Re-Atlasia
other_names: シアリム・エルトナム・レイアトラシア

title: elden_ring
body:
Elden Ring is a 2022 action role-playing game developed by [[fromsoftware|FromSoftware]] and published by [[bandai namco|Bandai Namco Entertainment]]. Directed by [[Miyazaki Hidetaka]] with worldbuilding provided by fantasy writer [[George R.R. Martin]].

In the game, players control a customizable player character on a journey to repair the titular [[Elden Ring (object)|]] and become the new Elden Lord.

title: elden_ring_nightreign
body:
Standalone multiplayer co-op (PVE) action survival game developed by [[FromSoftware]].

It is set in a universe parallel to the events of [[Elden Ring]], in a parallel Limgrave known as [b]Limveld[/b].

Set to launch in May 30, 2025.

title: zenra
body:
A fetish in which [[public nudity]] and sexual acts that otherwise would be considered [[public indecency]] is treated as a normal everyday activity.

"Zenra" is a Japanese word, literally translated as "[[completely nude]]". Zenra fetish features people (usually women) participating in everyday tasks that they might otherwise perform clothed, such as casual scenes with participants playing in an all-nude orchestra in a seemingly oblivious state of mind towards their nudity.

Others incorporate the nudity on a more conscious level by doing such things as playing "[[strip game|strip volleyball]]", where the participants must remove clothing each time the other team scores a point. While in some case [[sex]] and sexual acts were treated as a normal recreational activity in the setting, including in public places.

While very similar to [[exhibitionism]] and [[nudist|nudism]] in concept and often overlaps with each other, zenra fetish can be distinguished by how the setting treated nudity and sexual activity, as zenra fetish treats nudity either as a social norm at best and a minor inconvenience at worst. In addition, some zenra works also further emphasize sexual elements of the character (such as character exposing their private parts) as another form of beauty standard.

Please note that [[bathing]] or tanning on the beach are not zenra as that is normally done naked. In addition, since the word is used as a Pixiv tag for a [[completely nude]] character, only apply "zenra" tag if the setting is applicable.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "[[nudist]]" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "[[exhibitionism]]" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "zenra" is applicable.

h4. See also

* [[change in common sense]]
* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[nudist]]
* [[sex battle]]
* pool #1536: Casual Nudity

title: exhibitionism
body:
A fetish involving exposing one's body, either partially or entirely, or to commit sexual acts in public areas. The participant is almost always willing and often makes an overt effort to gain the attention of onlookers.

While similar to (and often overlaps with) [[zenra]], exhibitionism differs from zenra in the emphasis on exposing private parts or sexual arousal from being seen by others, whereas zenra involves [[nude]] people doing various activities, sexual or not, as if it were a normal occurence.

This tag is applicable when:

* Character(s) is seen with exposed private parts and/or in nude in public places, willingly or not. 
* Character(s) is seen committed sexual acts within the presence of other people or the [[crowd]].
* Character(s) is overtly and actively exposing their nudity toward others (such as the viewer, etc.) or is aware of their state of nudity but does not attempt to cover it.
* Character(s) is wearing a clothes so revealing that it would exposes their private parts, especially in public places. Do not apply this tag simply because character is wearing [[revealing clothes]], only apply when character is shown to be attempting to garner attention or are aware that other people saw them.

This tag is [b]not[/b] applicable when:

* Character(s) is not in a public place. Selfies and livestreams should not get tagged.
* Character(s) is wearing [[revealing clothes]], but the setting is not in public or in other's presence, such as in a blank background.
* Blank background. Use [[flashing]] for that.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "[[nudist]]" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "exhibitionism" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "[[zenra]]" is applicable.

h4. See also
h5. Other pubic indecency tags
* [[public indecency]]

* [[zenra]]

title: nudist
body:
The practice of [[nude|wearing little to no clothing]] to be "closer to [[nature]]," treating nudity as natural and nothing to be ashamed of.

This tag overlaps with (but not necessarily relates to) [[exhibitionism]] and [[zenra]], as nudists can be naked [[indoors]] (such as the privacy of their home), as opposed to the aforementioned fetishes that emphasize [[public nudity]] and exposure to others. Nudism is usually treated as a matter of personal preference rather than deliberate titillation.

Do not apply this tag simply because the character is naked. Other evidences in the image such as the character performing various mundane task naked, treat their nakedness as an ordinary matter, or is not involved in a sexual situation is required to identify this tag.

h6. As a rule of thumb:
* If the person in nude is aware of their nudity and is not in the act that requires them to be in nude (such as [[bathing]]) but does not attempt to cover it and acts as normal, then the tag "nudist" is applicable.
* If the person in nude is in public place, being in presence with other people, or is overtly showing their state of nudity to others, then the tag "[[exhibitionism]]" is applicable.
* If the setting of the image treats the state of nudity or sexual act as a normal activity, then the tag "[[zenra]]" is applicable.


h4. See also

* [[exhibitionism]]
* [[nude beach]]
* [[zenra]]

* "Wikipedia: Naturism":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naturism

She has an optional [[green capelet]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] with this costume she has [[very long hair]] in 3 possible hairstyles:

title: ironclad
body:
A type of [[warship]] prevalent in the latter half of the 19th century. Characterized by their iron, usually sloped armor (although later ones have steel armor, or some composite of the two) and use of coal powered steam power (although many earlier ones also kept sails for back up or fuel saving reasons).

They were later superseded by pre-dreadnought [[battleship]].

title: war
body:
An organized, armed, and, often, a prolonged conflict that is carried on between states, nations, or armed political organization using [[army|armies]] and [[soldier]]s. Typically to either resolve diplomatic or political disputes or as an aggressive diplomatic tool against other countries. War are usually carried out between two or more [[military]] of the opposing factions.

This tag can be applied to any depiction of war, either historical or fictional, as well as various aspects of it (such as death and destruction), either literally or symbolically.

title: naval_dress_uniform
body:
A [[naval uniform]] designed for non-combat, parade and ceremonial use. Just like the [[military dress uniform]] of other branches, they usually have more distinctive designs, that show various [[insignia]]s and other decorations like [[medal]]s or [[ribbon bar]]s. As well, naval dress uniforms tend to be clearer in showing [[military rank insignia|rank or rate]] than those of land or air forces, with officer ranks displayed as bands on the cuffs and/or shoulder boards, and enlisted rates displayed on the upper arms. 

h4. Examples

* !post #4732949: Officer's dress whites.

title: naval_uniform
body:
A [[military uniform]] worn by members of a navy. Typically these will be either white or khaki in summer or tropical regions, and black or very dark blue in winter or cold regions. A [[naval dress uniform]], meant for ceremonial purposes, would usually be worn for special occasions while ashore, but rarely worn on an active vessel. Conversely, a [[naval working uniform]] is the typical clothing worn while out at sea, and is usually meant more for protection than for good looks. 

h4. Examples 

* !post #6226073: [[Naval working uniform]]s
* !post #3808860: [[Naval dress uniform]]
* !post #2382164

h4. See also

* [[List of Armed Forces]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: naval_working_uniform
body:
A [[naval uniform]] that is worn by during day to day work on a ship. At-sea uniforms are intended more for protection than for good looks: long [[pants]] and long sleeve [[shirt]]s protect against sunburn and fire. The traditional [[sailor collar]] was another method to protect the neck and shoulder area, though more modern uniforms are made of fire-resistant materials to assist as well. Officer's uniforms are also distinctly different from those of the enlisted, usually wearing blue or khaki clothes, depending on the time period and nationality. As with [[naval dress uniform]], at-sea uniforms of both officers and enlisted qualify for this tag. 

h4. Examples

* !post #8307272
* !post #2191029

h4. See also

* [[Naval dress uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Navy Working Uniform":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Navy_Working_Uniform

title: frozone

title: niconico
body:
Niconico (ニコニコ) is a popular Japanese video sharing site. The site is sometimes still known by its old name, Niconico Douga (ニコニコ動画, [i]Niconico Video[/i]), and similarly so still believed to require registration to watch any videos onsite, when access has been loosened up over the years.

Niconico has several sister sites:

* Niconico Seiga (ニコニコ静画, [i]Niconico Imageboard[/i]), an imageboard. There was a NSFW section called Niconico Shunga (ニコニコ春画), but this was shut down on January 29th 2025. 
* Niconico Nama Hosou (ニコニコ生放送, [i]Niconico Live Streaming[/i]), a livestreaming service. Often abbreviated as ニコ生 or ニコなま.
* Nicopedia (ニコニコ大百科), a wiki system. Each article also has a [[2channel]]-like [[oekaki]] board.

A unique feature of Nicovideo is that user comments are displayed as a scrolling feed over the video. See [[Danmaku comments]].

Niconico's mascot character is called "Niconico TV-chan (ニコニコテレビちゃん)":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/695104 (tagged here as [[Terebi-chan]]).

This tag is used for posts referencing the site itself, and locations associated with the site (such as the old [[niconico headquarters (harajuku)|Harajuku HQ]]), as well as for various Niconico(-adjacent) characters that have gained some fanart.

h4. See also

* [[AcFun]]
* [[Bilibili]] (A Chinese video site with similar style)

* [[2024 niconico cyberattack]]
* [[Niconico RPG]]

title: dragon_ball_(object)
body:
The namesake objects of the [i][[Dragon Ball]][/i] series are seven magical [[orb]]s that have a number of red stars corresponding to their order in the sequence (from 1 to 7).

When all seven Dragon Balls are collected and gathered together, they allow the user to summon [[Shenron (dragon_ball)|a powerful dragon]] who will grant a number of wishes (originally one, later three). Once the wish is granted, it cannot be granted again, and the balls fly off to the ends of the earth and become nothing but inert stone until a year has passed, at which point they become Dragon Balls again.

Earth's dragon balls were created by an alien from planet [[Namek]] named [[Kami-sama (dragon ball)|Kami]].

title: shiratori_aira_(dandadan)
body: Shiratori Aira is a supporting character of the manga series [[Dandadan]]. She is a student who was formerly popular at the same school as [[Ayase Momo]] and [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]]. After finding one of [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]]'s kintama, Aira comes under the pretense that she is the "chosen one" that is meant to protect the world from evil and sees [[Ayase Momo]] as being her enemy. However, she unadmittedly serves as one of her main allies whenever the two are faced with the paranormal.

title: mexican_standoff
body:
[b]Mexican standoff[/b] is a strategic deadlock or impasse, in which no party can act in a way that ensures victory.

In popular culture, the Mexican standoff is often portrayed as two or more opponents with [[weapon]]s [[aiming|aimed]] at each other, usually at extremely close range, such that each opponent feels equally threatened and does not believe he can strike or shoot first without endangering his own life. 

h5. Example
* !post #2966291

h4. See also

* [[at gunpoint]]
* [[at knifepoint]]
* [[battle]]
* [[crosscounter]]

title: surrendering
body:
An act of giving up the [[fighting|fight]] in order to prevent further potential negative consequences, such as [[death]]. Often signified with a [[white flag]].

A person who is surrendering may be shown with [[arms up]] or [[arms behind head|behind their head]] to signify that they are unarmed and are no longer willing to resist.

h4. See also
* [[At gunpoint]]
* [[Threat]]

title: irisviel_von_einzbern
body:
A homunculus coined by the Einzbern family based on the archetype of Lizleihi Justica von Einzbern, thus referred as a Justica-late model. 

The one who became the mother body of the ultimate homunculus, among all Einzbern homunculi in the past, she is the only one who experienced motherhood and gave birth to a successor. 

Loves [[Emiya Kiritsugu]], her husband, and [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]], her daughter.

A version of her wearing the Dress of Heaven is an event-related [[irisviel von einzbern (caster)|Caster-class Servant]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: batman
body:
A superhero from [[DC Comics]] and the titular main hero of the [i][[Batman (series)|]][/i] franchise.

His real name is [[Bruce Wayne]], a wealthy man who witnessed his parents' murders and vowed to fight crime in Gotham City. He dons a black [[superhero costume]] and bat-themed mask, and utilizes gadgets and martial arts rather than superpowers like traditional superheroes. Also known as [[the Dark Knight]].

In many crossover media, Batman is frequently depicted as a rival of [[Superman]], primarily due to their contrasting qualities. Such as Superman's usage of superhuman power compared to Batman's usage of gadgets, and their clashing philosophies regarding how to handle a villain.

He was created by the late Bob Kane and the late Bill Finger and debuted in [i]Detective Comics[/i] #27 (1939).

h4. See also

* [[Robin (DC)]]
* [[Superman]]
* [[Ougon Bat]]

title: hilda_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
[b]Hilda[/b] is one of the antagonists of the story in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is one of the founders of the faction, [b]Amnesia[/b]. Her main goal is to become a Re-Birth and plans to shape the Hollow Night in her own image. She is also known as [b]Paradox[/b] by some. She seeks out [[Kido hyde|Hyde]] (whom she calls "Insulator Boy") for the Insulator he posses. In Hilda's ending, [spoiler]she ends up killing both Hyde and [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]], acquiring the Insulator.[/spoiler]

title: sabrina_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Sabrina[/b], known as [b]Natsume[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [[pokemon rgby|Pokémon Red and Green]].

A powerful psychic herself, this Gym Leader who uses Psychic types can see the future with her precognitive powers. She allegedly does not like conflict. Her signature Pokémon is [[Alakazam]].

In her [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, she has [[pink eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears a [[bodysuit]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[pink jacket|pink]] [[turtleneck jacket|turtleneck]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] jacket, [[white gloves|gloves]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] [[side slit]] skirt, [[yellow thighhighs|yellow]] [[over-kneehighs]], and [[pink boots]].

In her [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, she has pink eyes, [[long hair|long]] [[flipped hair]], a [[crop top|cropped]] [[pink camisole]] that exposes [[midriff]], large [[bracelet]]s, [[white pants]], and [[pink slippers]].

h4. Appearance

title: capitano_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character. Also known by his codename "The Captain", he is the first of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers.

He is a survivor of the Khaenri'ah Calamity, originally known as Thrain, and cursed with immortality by [[Ronova (genshin impact)|]], the Shade of Death.

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, he is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

h4. See also
* "Capitano Unmasked":[/pools/24669]

h4. The Fatui Harbingers

title: son_gohan
body:
The first son of [[Son Goku]] and [[Chi-chi (dragon ball)|]] in [[Dragon Ball]]. He is named after Goku's adoptive grandfather [[Grandpa Gohan]].

Gohan is the first half-[[Saiyan]] of the series, and as such he inherited the fighting prowess of his father while being less "battle eager" due to his mother. He is later on married with [[Videl]] and had a daughter named [[Pan (dragon ball)|]].

Like the other male members of the Goku family, Gohan is voiced by [[Nozawa Masako]].

h4. Forms / Variants
* [[Son Gohan (Future)]]
* [[Son Gohan (Xeno)]]
* [[Great Saiyaman]]
* [[Gohan Beast]]
* [[Gohan Black]]

title: messenger_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An Emanator of Remembrance aboard the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]].

She is portrayed [[faceless female|faceless]] (covered by a crystal), and wears a [[white hoodie|white]] [[hooded dress]] over a [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress]]. In-game, they give access to the Forgotten Hall and Memory of Chaos game modes. 

Note that the appearance applies to persons associated with the Garden of Recollection: the Messenger should not be confused with Memosnatchers (post #8822199) if she is depicted in the Astral Express.

title: emperor_gol
body:
Main antagonist of the original [[Getter Robo (classic)|]] anime and manga. 
Reptiloid ruler of the Dinosaur Empire. He seeks to wipe out all of humanity so the Reptiloids become the dominant species on earth once more after nearly being wiped out by [[getter rays|Cosmic Radiation]] that bombarded the Earth millions of years ago.

title: player_character_(splatoon)
body:
A customizable player character from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. The player can choose between an [[Inkling Girl]] and [[Inkling Boy]]. Players who acquired the Octo Expansion in [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]] are also given the option to select  [[Octoling Girl]] and [[Octoling Boy]] as well. With [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]] making all four options available by default.

This tag is for both the Inklings and Octoling that serve as the player's character, and for swim form Inklings and Octolings (post #2028621). Essentially acting as a fusion for both the [[inkling_player_character]] and [[octoling_player_character]] tags. Just like with those two, do not use it for named non-player characters such as [[Callie_(splatoon)|]] or [[Marina_(splatoon)|]].

[b]See [[Inkling]] and [[Octoling]] (species) Wiki for a list of named Inklings (e.g. the Idols) and a section on how to differentiate between Inklings and [[Octoling]]s.[/b]
h4. List of officially named player characters
* !post #7360649: [[Kaori_(splatoon)|]] and [[John_(splatoon)|]]
* !post #7430197: [[Surume_(splatoon)|]] and [[Cuttlefrsh_(splatoon)|]]

title: cabbie_hat
body:
Also known as a "newsboy cap".

It has a stiff [[visor]] in front and a band. The body of the hat is roundish and puffy. Not to be confused with [[beret]]s, which are often flat or floppy with the band under its body and no visor. It has a similar shape to a [[flat cap]], but the body of the cap is rounder, made of eight pieces, fuller, and paneled with a button on top.

* !post #3999062
* !post #6135580

title: guncannon_mp_type
body:
A fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RX-77D Guncannon Mass Production Type[/b]

Also known as the [b]Mass Produced Guncannon[/b], it is a subtype of [[Guncannon]] that first appeared [spoilers](and was immediately destroyed)[/spoilers] in [[Gundam 0080]]. 

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]].

title: c4l4m4r_(splatoon)
body:
[b]C4L4M4R[/b] is an [[inkling_boy|inkling boy]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].
h4. Appearance
He wears a black aviator hat with, a button-down shirt made from many different colorful fabrics and a pair of black, blue and yellow sneakers that exposes the toes and heels. He also has long hair with abrupt cuts at the ends.

title: takotruck_(splatoon)
body:
[b]TakoTruck[/b] is an [[octoling_girl|octoling girl]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].
h4. Appearance
She's commonly seen wearing a bicycle helm, a khaki vest worn over a dirty white, short-sleeved, buttoned-up shirt and a pair of beige boots for cold weather. Her hair-tentacles are curly and frame her face.

title: stephanie_(splatoon)
body:
[b]Stephanie[/b] is an [[inkling_girl|inkling girl]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].
h4. Appearance
She wears horned viking helm, blue-rimmed glasses, green tank top with a large white shirt underneath and black and red work boots. She has dark skin and long hair-tentacles that frame her face, similar to [[kaori_(splatoon)|Kaori]].

title: yarrwhal_(splatoon)
body:
[b]YARRwhal[/b] is an [[octoling_boy|octoling boy]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].
h4. Appearance
He wears round tinted goggles, a red protective vest with a long-sleeved patterned shirt underneath and a pair of vibrant red shoes resembling tabi socks. His tentacle hair has been stylized into a spiraling pompadour and is frequently seen colored yellow.

title: kayoss_(splatoon)
body:
[b]kAyOSs[/b] is an [[octoling_boy|octoling boy]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]].
h4. Appearance
He is frequently seen wearing a yellow face mask, blue long-sleeved shirt and black sandals. He is also sometimes seen with glass-less glasses and a multicolored shirt. He has dark skin and his hair has been cut into four extremely short tentacles resembling buns.

title: anemoneno1_(splatoon)
body:
[b]AnemoneNo1[/b] is an [[inkling_girl|inkling girl]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]], she serves as the game's tertiary player mascot.
h4. Appearance
She wears a pair of pixel-styled glasses, a light grey hoodie and a pair of large thick red basketball shoes. Her hair is short and messy and most commonly seen colored either yellow or purple-blue.

title: hirooooo_(splatoon)
body:
[b]Hirooooo[/b] is an [[octoling_boy|octoling boy]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]], she serves as the game's secondary player mascot.
h4. Appearance
He's commonly seen wearing a pair of red headphones, a cream guayabera with dark brown buttons, and a pair of laceless sneakers with translucent silvery-blue straps. His hair tentacle has been stylized in such a way that it frames both sides of his face and is most frequently seen colored into a purple-blue team color.

title: veronika_(splatoon)
body:
[b]VeronIKA[/b] is an [[inkling_girl|inkling girl]] who first appeared in the promotional material of [[splatoon_3|Splatoon 3]], she serves as the game's primary player mascot.
h4. Appearance
She's frequently seen wearing a tattered white shirt and a pair of crude grey and red high-top boots. Her left-side hair tentacle has been stylized into a braid and she is most commonly seen with the yellow team color. 
h4. See Also
* [[agent_3_(splatoon_3)|Agent 3 of Splatoon 3]]

title: tof-u_(splatoon)
body:
[b]Tof-U[/b] is an [[inkling_girl|inkling girl]] who was first introduced in [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]].
h4. Appearance
She wears a blue and yellow painter's mask. A ink-striped white shirt, and brown and blue rubber hunting boots. Her long hair tentacles has been tied into a bun at the back of her head and is most commonly colored dark blue.

title: kou_(splatoon)
body:
[b]Kou[/b] is an [[inkling_girl|inkling girl]] who was first introduced in [[splatoon_2|Splatoon 2]].
h4. Appearance
She wears a knitted hat, a blue hoodie with a white and green striped shirt underneath, along with a pair of red leather dress shoes with black laces. Her long tentacle hair has been swept to her left side and is commonly seen colored light green.
